Reviews.Title: “Brilliant in every way”
Reviews.Author: Ian220451
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four days - April 19-22 - in the Saturnia International. It was brilliant in every way. I'm really shocked to read the review by Fab4 which bears no resemblance at all to the reality we experienced. The Hotel was incredibly comfortable, well-organised, and brilliantly situated a stone's throw from the centre of Venice. There are hidden FREE extras that add even more to the value of the stay. For example, a complimentary boat-ride to and guided tour of Cenedese, a glass-blowing company on the island of Murano would probably normally cost two people at least a 100 euros. It cost us nothing at all, and was one of the finest experiences. Factor that into an already reasonably priced sojourn and you begin to appreciate the value of staying in this hotel. In addition, the concierge went out of his way to ensure that our choice among the many attractive musical and opera options available resulted in a truly unique experience. The concierge was not interested in merely doing what was expected: he went much further and ensured that his guests enjoyed those extra delights on offer in this incredible city. A couple of requests we made late at night - an extra blanket on one night and a pot of boiling water (not tea) on another night - resulted in delivery on each occasion in no more than a couple of minutes and with customary warmth and good humour. Our room was spacious and comfortable, great shower and bath facilities with ample gushing hot water, high ceilings, quiet second-floor solitude with shutters ensuring peace and quiet. Breakfast worked like a charm, with intelligent buffet lay-out to preclude queues, and staff warmly in attendance to ensure one's every need. A hugely impressive establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: NYCWomen
Reviews.Content: We just returned on April 16th having spent eight wonderful days in Venice at the Hotel Saturnia. The hotel location is perfect - just minutes from San Marco - near but yet away from the crowds. We had two rear rooms on the first floor with windows opening to a canal where we could enjoy the gondolas passing beneath our windows. Everything - the rooms (super clean and comfortable) - the food (very good both breakfast and their restaurant, La Caravella) and the entire staff (helpful, courteous and knowledgeable) all contributed to making our stay truly memorable. Special kudos to Giovanni and Andreas who always steered us in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Mix of Old World Charm & New World Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Debbie-Pack
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely - full of antiques, old beams and Venice history but at the same time comfy beds, lots of plugs, great showers and even for me a Jacuzzi bath! I went with my parents & they gave us adjoining rooms as requested & both rooms were perfect. The hotel is spotless & the breakfast was first class. Lots of choice, excellent pastries and the facility to boil eggs to your liking (runny with soldiers for me!). Andrea the concierge was as fantastic as others had commented. He was helpful, funny and happy to answer any questions either on life in Venice, where to eat or what to see. The hotel is perfectly located, near St Marks Square, the Vaporetti and lots of restaurants. We took the free water taxi to Murano offered by the hotel - the glass making demonstration was informative & really skilled. We weren't pressured into buying afterwards, so don't be intimidated. I did succumb to some jewelry though! We ate twice in the hotel restaurant and the food & service were excellent. This will be the hotel I choose (&recommend) for any visit to Venice

Reviews.Title: “5 Wonderful Days in Venice”
Reviews.Author: SheilaStokeontrent
Reviews.Content: A wonderful Hotel..our room was at the rear (61)...on the 2nd floor.I was a little disappointed at first as it seemed quite a small room...but it grew on us...a king size bed which although firm was comfortable. The room was very hot on our arrival & their air con does not work in the winter so we opened the 2 windows wide...big mistake as I was bitten by something on my wrist that night.. we remembered to close the windows at dusk..( March 2012)..but the cleaners still turned the heating back up every day despite us turning it off !!! There was a fridge & safe contained within a locked glass fronted cupboard to which we had the key, which was useful. The bathroom was fine as was the shower & there was a hairdrier which actually worked. The breakfasts have been well described by many others & are excellent, the staff are great & seem to know everything & anything about Venice. We went to Murano on the water taxi ...a freebie from this hotel....worth it even if you do end up at the glass factory of their choice.....well worth it for the other bits of Venice you see on the way...after the tour, we arranged to stay longer & had lunch there before our return. The Hotel also arranged our Gondola trip, which although not cheap was well worth it! The location is wonderful, the sundeck shows the 360 degree panaramic view of the city,. We did check our emails one day using their computers on the 2nd floor, but with so much more to do it was not that important to us. We had travelled to the hotel by waterbus which took 1 hr & 45 mins. We left by water taxi from the rear of the hotel...this took 20 mins...not cheap...110 euros. We split that with another couple from our flight.....well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & great service”
Reviews.Author: RAG19
Reviews.Content: Great hotel a short walk from San Marco, wonderful location. The rooms are comfortable and the restaurant is delicious (expensive though). There was a free tour to a glass factory in Murano which was great. The staff was friendly and very helpful. If you have the budget to do so, a taxi to the airport is â‚¬100, but it's worth it instead of the long walk from the bus with your suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: ioana c
Reviews.Content: Very good location in the heart of Venice. Helpful front desk staff. But they gave us first an inferior room and only when we said no, they changed it according with the rate we have paid. So, pay attention! The room was large for italian standards, with antique-venetian style furniture and, of course, beautiful Murano lamps. But the bathroom needed renovation. Very nice breakfast room and very good breakfast, with attentive and helpfull staff. General opinion is of a good hotel, but a litlle dusty (plastic flowers at the windows!) which needs more upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in Venice at Hotel Saturnia & International”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend at the Hotel Saturnia & International. The hotel staff was amazingly helpful and offered suggestions on everything from where to go, what times to go, where to eat, what to order, etc. They have a complimentary shuttle to Murano glass factory that we did not attend but others said it was good. The room we stayed in was nice (#78); interior room over looking a courtyard with very high ceilings and large windows, seperate bathtub and shower and lots of closets. The bed was king size and a bit firm with lots of pillows. There was a desk, couch and table area. There was air conditioning but we didn't need it. The hotel has a roof deck with lounge chairs and great 360 views, it provided a nice back drop for a bottle of wine one late afternoon. the breakfast was great with plentiful offerings of traditional italian, british and american breakfast. The location of the hotel was ideal for us, less than five minute walk to piazza san marco, less than ten minute walk to Academia Bridge and Rialto bridge. The hotel is located on the "5th avenue" of Venice with high end retail all around. The Hotel Regina Europa is three blocks away on the grand canal. I only mention as a point of reference because not many people, Venitians included, knew where the hotel was when they asked where we were staying. The only negative thing we experienced at the hotel was the internet connection, it is complimentary but you get a temporary username and password from the front desk for 3hrs. We found the connection to drop frequently and could not get back on with the same username and password. We were using an ipad and a macbook, maybe that had something to do with it but it was really annoying....but we weren't there to be on the internet so it wasn't a big deal. All in all, we really enjoyed the hotel and the staff. The overall value of the hotel was great, everything in venice is expensive but we found that this hotel offered a very pleasant stay at about half the going rate for comparable rated hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful weekend in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: All of the staff at the hotel were very friendly, helpful and extremely pleasant at all times. The continental breakfast at the hotel was excellent and would also recommend that visitors try the hotel restuarant as this was also of the highest quality. The hotel is also perfect for the upmarket shopping part of Venice and only a short walk to the San Marco water bus stop. Would recommend the hotel to any of our friends visiting Venice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon bliss”
Reviews.Author: downtheavenue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned in Italy in May 2011 (so late to review!). Our first stop was Venice. Oh my. What an amazing city and this hotel could not be more perfect. Location was absolutely wonderful, staff was great, and the breakfast?? I dream of that breakfast. Seriously. Thank you so much for starting our marriage off right. :)

Reviews.Title: “Music Tour to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Martin S
Reviews.Content: We went on Music Tour to Venice and a friend had recommended the hotel to our group to stay. Initial comment from early arrivals to the rest of us "we have struck gold here" and we had. fantastic location for all you need to see easy walking to all locations and easy access to public water taxi's, but ensure you have comfortable walking shoes because you have to get lost in Venice to appreciate all the surprises it has to offer, be brave and throw away the map!! All very helpful reception staff. Room 203 very quiet and plenty of space, great bath to relax in after long walks. A most magical 3 day visit and will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 2 days to end our honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: EnTee77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I honeymooned in Italy for 8 nights last year. We decided to go all out in Venice. We read reviews and researched to find Hotel Saturnia. We could not be more pleased with our selection. We stayed in room 204. This room was incredible. It is bigger than my first apartment. Updated bath. Separate toilet/tub and shower. The king size bed was extremely comfortable. We had two balconies overlooking the channel behind the hotel. We kept the doors open most of the day and were serenaded constantly by singing gondoliers. The breakfast spread was absolutely amazing. They had meats, serials, bread and pastries, yogurt. Hot, cold, everything imaginable. The hotel is located in San Marco, just a hop, skip and a jump away from Piazza San Marco. When you walked out the front door, you're looking at Blvgari, Gucci, and much more. They have wireless internet, though the staff knew nothing about a few issues it was experiencing, but they were willing to listen to me(an IT guy) and all was resolved. I'm a normal guy so Venice was incredible and Hotel Saturnia made me feel like a king.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: GladKent_UK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Saturnia. We were in Room 105 overlooking the canal which made our stay extra special. There was some noise from boats making deliveries in the mornings but that's all part of being in Venice! We liked the fact that the hotel is family run and not part of a huge international chain: it definitely had a quirky charm all of its own! The staff were very friendly and helpful, particularly when our suitcase didn't arrive until the next day - the concierges kept chasing this up and seemed to be as pleased as we were when the bag turned up. In an earlier post, a reviewer mentions never seeing the female concierge "everyone raves about": I assume this is a reference to Andrea and that the reviewer doesn't realise that Andrea is a man's name in Italy........ The breakfasts were great and the situation of the hotel (close to San Marco but in a quiet area) was ideal - we will definitely be back :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Terrific Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Gizmo16304
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the most attentive concierge that i have ever experienced. We stayed there at the end of March for 3 nights as a first stop for our honeymoon. It is a given that the location is perfect, just a stone's through away from San Marco Square, but as well, the rooms were spacious and clean and the breakfast was ample. i loved hearing only the sound of an occasional seagull and churchbells when we opened the window in the morning. Quite a pleasant experience. I would like to thank the staff for making our first couple of days in Italy a most delightful experience.

Reviews.Title: “a refreshing oasis of calm a stone's throw from San Marco”
Reviews.Author: cecelia0617
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights in March 2012. This hotel was a good choice for several reasons. The location could not have been more convenient. It was close to San Marco, yet the room was quiet and peaceful: with the windows open, we could hear the church bells and seagulls. The room was lovely and my only complaint is that the beds were a bit hard - I imagine this is quite common in Italy. The staff were very helpful and they even ran a package to me at the Alilaguna stop when I forgot it and left it in my room upon departing. The breakfast had a large array of choices and the coffee was delicious. The trip to a Murano glass-making factory was quite an esperience but beware: they really DO expect you to buy something (we did, in moderation). We will certainly consider staying here upon returning to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 11EmJaysee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three night over the Carnival as part of a rail holiday to Florence. The water taxi to the rear entrance was an experience and the luggage was handled for us and delivered to our rooms. Couldn't believe that both the towels and bedding were changed every day! Lovely to get into nice fresh sheets after a very busy day sight seeing. The choice of food for breakfast was amazing and the dining room lovely. The decore throughout was stunning especially the Murano glass chandeliers. The staff were extremely helpful and their English was much better than our Italian! Only downside was there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the bedroom, however we were given complimentary tea or coffee in the bar area and found it a nice relaxing place.

Reviews.Title: “It worked for us and it should for you.”
Reviews.Author: Caheragh
Reviews.Content: I see there are a small number of negative comments and know that everyone will have their own opinion but we were delighted with our choice. I stayed here with my wife and daughter in 2 rooms for 4 nights. The location is close to perfect and it is easy to get to with the Water Bus, No 1 or No 2. As an older building it has it's own individuality as do many Hotels in Italy and so the rooms are different but the 2 we had were excellent. The staff are very helpful, amazingly so bearing in mind they answer similar questions from many, many tourists day in, day out. Breakfast is extensive and more than adequate to set you up for the day. A very nice touch is complimentary afternoon each day at 4.30, much appreciated given it was freezing and the cost for this is expensive elsewhere. There is also a complimentary Water Taxi to Murano and back, interesting but a dangerous temptation when you are there. St. Marks, Academia, Rialto are within easy reach. The whole package would satisfy all but the 1% who would be unlucky or difficult to make happy. We were firmly in the very happy 99%.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: Stansmum4420
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my daughter the weekend before Christmas 2011. This hotel was great, the staff were lovely, really helpful. Perfect English was spoken (phew) The room was a good size and it was no problem having twin beds. The bathroom was spotless. Breakfast was plentiful and lots of choice. We stayed two nights and on the last night due to having walked our legs off we ate in the Hotel restaurant, my daughter had the fish which she loved, I had the beef which was superb, I think it was the best beef i have ever had!!! It was cooked in front of us in the restaurant. The hotel couldn't be better located, it was no more than a two minute walk to St Marks Square, so very central. Well Done to this hotel. :)

Reviews.Title: “Saturnia international hotel Venice, the most sincere place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Graham P
Reviews.Content: There are for sure many places in Venice that indeed have a unique offer, and more than enough reasons why you should try each and everyone of them.....I did...over a number of years, and in each I found a magical memory that often resulted in me returning, and recommending that hotel to my family and friends. I thought that I could never ever be made to feel unwanted or unappreciated in any hotel in Venice, so choosing was easy, then one very warm summers day I came across a restaurant in a courtyard, I had passed it many times, its bright yellow decor of tablecloths and flora, antique wall furnishings and scene beckoned me to stop and look, and I did, I fell in love with the magic that was clearly in every corner of this outdoor room, no matter if in the day or evening this little gem of a place was truly romantic, what ever visions I had of Venice, whatever thoughts or dreams I had of this place they all seemed to gather in this one place. I reserved a table for lunch, and what a lunch it was....the service the style and the content both food and wine, confirmed my belief that this was a very much loved place where those who really appreciated the finer things in life would have come to and returned time after time. The opportunity came for me to wander around the hotel that this fine restaurant belonged to, and it was here I found the Saturnia International Hotel. I couldnt wait until my next trip to Venice, I decided there and then to take a week in this wonderful palace of Venetian hospitality. It was no surprise that this hotel had received some pretty important guests over the years, and it was not hard to understand why they returned time and time again. From the outside it looks warm, even in the coldest of winters, during the summer the courtyard restaurants colourful display invited you in, the moment you arrived at reception, you were met by a smile that said welcome to our home, please sit awhile, relax, what can we do for you....our time is yours, nothing is too much trouble, we are here because we want to be, because we like you, value your custom and we thrive on being of service in any way possible. This was done and said conveyed to anyone who walked through the door, and the staff no matter front of house or back, cleaners or management, they all loved the opportunity to be of service to you. Time went by very quickly, my return to Venice was made much more special, because we were going to the teatro Fenice, and the beauty was much more than anyone could ever hope for, the Saturnia was the icing on the cake and I can honestly say each day was made increasingly more romantic with the love that came out of every nook and cranny of this adorable hotel, we hated to leave, but we looked forward to our return, we left wanting more, and year after year it just got better, and so although this is an opinion I hope with all my heart that you try it for yourself, a special place for special people wanting to celebrate life, with a eye on the past and eye on the future, and a hug that says welcome to Venice. I would always say that to arrive in Venice, one must take a water taxi, the view from these very stylish boats is one that is worth every penny, the experience one not to miss and the magic is amazing, when you arrive at your hotels doorstep, what a way to arrive..... Enjoy, The concierge at the Saturnia is Andrea, he is a handsome kind loveable sincere gentleman who is the ultimate in Venetian representation, he is the one person to whomever you could ask a favour and with kind heart he will say yes...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: Kate588
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a weekend in January. The location was great, in one of the more upmarket shopping streets, and a 2 minute walk to St Mark's square. The hotel was beautiful, full of history and very well maintained and clean. Initially I was a little dissapointed as the pictures of the rooms had looked so elaborate and our room was quite simple, however it was a decent size room and it was clean, with everything that we needed, so the dissapointment did not last long. The staff were amazing, so friendly and helpful (particularly the concierge, Andrea) who can tell you anything you want to know about Venice. It was quiet in the evenings but close enough to restaurants and coffee bars. The breakfast buffet was also great. Good vlaue for money. Definitely a recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellant location”
Reviews.Author: bentleysinoz
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel located close to all the major tourist attractions. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful and organised a free tour to the glass factories at Murano which was most interesting. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay over New Yearâ€™s Eve”
Reviews.Author: McGAussie
Reviews.Content: We loved our four night stay at this hotel and our dinner on New Yearâ€™s Eve. Initially we were disappointed as our room was down two corridors to the back of the hotel, and upon entering it seemed small for a Standard Double and was painted a deep red. However, by the time we left weâ€™d fallen in love with our little â€œgarretâ€� as it was quiet and restful. Although there wasnâ€™t a lot of room to manoeuvre around the large double bed, the wardrobe was spacious, the flat-screen TV of adequate size, the window opened onto a quiet, private courtyard, and the air-conditioning was quiet and warming. However, the highlight was the bathroom with itâ€™s deep, oval shaped bath with hand-held showerhead, large basin with a practical shelf underneath for toilet bags, plus a separate shower room with a huge rainwater showerhead and lots of hot water. Although lovely toiletries were supplied, the hairdryer was the cheap, wall attached variety and no bathrobes were supplied â€“ minor disappointments really. The Reception staff were very friendly and efficient, upon check in they confirmed our booking for dinner on New Yearâ€™s Eve (even given the choice of first or second sitting â€“ different rooms, menus and prices) and then escorted us to our room. Every time we passed Reception thereafter we were warmly greeted by name and stopped for a quick chat. Our New Yearâ€™s Eve degustation dinner with accompanying wines was wonderful and the wait staff were professional yet having fun too. The day before I had met with the maÃ®tre d' to discuss the menu as I have a food allergy. An offending course was easily substituted with something (more delicious in my opinion) from the regular menu without leaving me feeling as if I had caused any issue. We normally donâ€™t eat in hotel restaurants as we tend to find them overpriced, but NYE was worth every Euro. Circumstance meant we had to eat again in the restaurant on our last evening and the wait staff remembered us from NYE and helped to make it another special occasion. We can also suggest a small wine bar/trattoria, Vino Vino, on C d Veste just around the corner from the hotel where the atmosphere was certainly less formal and food prices more economical, however, we didnâ€™t see any decals (not to say they werenâ€™t there) advertising acceptance of credit cards and didnâ€™t observe anyone paying by card so we chose to pay by cash to prevent any embarrassment. We had arrived in Venice by train and managed to negotiate the vaporetto system to the nearest stop (S. Maria d Giglio) at â‚¬6.50 ea, then pulled our suitcases down narrow streets, through the tourist crowds and over a bridge to the hotel at its very central location (yet close to Piazza San Marco). When we asked Reception for advice on how to get to the airport for our departure, we were given two options: either private water taxi at â‚¬110 taking approx 30 minutes, or Alilaguna ferry from San Marco taking up to an hour. After checking out the Alilaguna option for ourselves, we chose instead for the hotel to organise a water taxi for us and were most appreciative that we did â€“ what a luxurious way to finish a wonderful holiday (and much better than any gondola ride on a winter's day).

Reviews.Title: “Retired Couple”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Saturnia for four nights in December. We found it to be perfectly situated on the main pedestrian thoroughfare a few minutes walk from St Mark's Square and we had a quiet, well appointed room. Our first contact with the staff was by email to enquire about transport from the airport to the hotel and facilities in the room, which was handled immediately and comprehensively. The hotel arranged our transport which, while expensive, functioned like clockwork. On arrival we received a friendly welcome and over the four days the concierge patiently attended to our needs, The breakfast room was always busy, but calm and with no pressure to 'move on', and with enough staff to keep the tables in an uncluttered state of readiness. The food was well presented and wide-ranging. A particular and very welcome feature of the hotel's service lies in the assistance given to the first time visitor. This ranges from the provision of maps, suggestions as to walking routes, nothing was too much trouble. On leaving our lasting impression was this was a hotel that not only referred to its customers as guests, it treated them as welcome guests with individual requirements, and wished to make their stay in Venice as memorable and rewarding as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit â€“ Superb hotel and service!”
Reviews.Author: GeoffandRosemarie
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Saturnia for our annual Venetian visit in late November/early December. We were once again delighted with our stay!!! We experienced the warm and friendly attention and service that keeps us coming back. Over the years we have stayed in a number of rooms..all spacious and interesting and nicely decorated. Breakfast is wonderful and has a nice variety to satisfy all tastes. Andrea and all at the front desk are always welcoming without being intrusive. They can be relied on to provide many suggestions for things to do and places to see. We also suggest dealing directly with the hotel to make reservations. Donâ€™t forget to dine at La Caravella â€“ it is also superb!!! We were delighted with our 2011 return to the Saturnia - the Serandrei family and their staff treat us as their valued guests and welcome us like old friends. We look forward to our next visit, hopefully in 2012!

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Jackief1962
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at this hotel 3 times! The hotel itself is in a fantastic location, it offers a great selection of rooms from traditional to modern or a bit of both. The staff are warm, welcoming and always ready to assist in any way they can. Special mention must go to the concierge Andrea who besides speaking 6 languages fluently is also a great listener. He seeks to understand who you are and what kind of experience you are looking for and then goes out of his way to make this happen for you. Wonderful! We checked out at 12 noon and the hotel stored our luggage till we departed Venice at 5pm. We were also offered a selection of English novels to choose from (as we had finished our own) in case we wished to read on our trip to the the UK. Will definitely be back. A big thank you to all at the Hotel Saturnia for making our Christmas truly special.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: SXMGirl
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Saturnia in September, while on tour with Queenslander Tours. Would highly recommend this hotel for it's central location...a short walk to Piazza San Marco and many of the other attractions in Venice. The hotel is old, but the rooms were very comfortable and clean. The staff was always pleasant and helpful when we asked for directions. The breakfast was delicious....many hot and cold items to choose from..one of the best we had while on tour. We fell in love with Venice and would definitely return to the Saturnia on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Nov 2011”
Reviews.Author: ce w
Reviews.Content: We arrived by water taxi stopping at marble steps and a wrought iron gate. A bellman escorted us into a marble hallway. Our room with high ceiling overlooking the canal in this historic hotel was very comfortable. The full breakfast included was the best in Europe with delicious coffee. The concierge had tickets for The Dolges Palace for us (I emailed in advance); the walk to St Mark's Sq was quick and beautiful. Convenient central location.

Reviews.Title: “ItÂ´s a"must" staying in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ratpackvienna
Reviews.Content: Manytimes during the last 30 years I stayed in the Saturnia-either for business or for pleasure again in the first days of dec 2011.Saturnia remains what it always used to be for the client: excellent location between San Marco and Accademia, an old interesting palazzo (very nice on the one hand-but means as well old fashioned rooms with old fashioned furniture on the other), a really first class restaurant and outstanding service-especially by the ladies and and gentlemen in the reception:caring for your walks,your water taxis,recommended concerts, events,galleries,museums, restaurants .i.e.every advice and help you may need.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable centrally placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hampshirevoyager
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on an off season offer that was very good value. The hotel has been owned by the same family for 100 years and they have one other hotel in Venice. The building has been added to over the years and our section had narrow corridors and short flights of stairs to the bedroom which was comfortable with a good sized bathroom. Breakfast was good with many choices. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel which is frequented by non-residents. itIis very expensive and we did not try it. The hotel is 250 metres from St Marks Square in one of the premier shopping streets in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daichopstixAberteifi
Reviews.Content: An extremely comfortable hotel, well situated for exploring Venice. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble for them. The restaurant was cosy and the food excellent, but at a price which one would expect for the quality, (in fact, all Venetian prices are quite high). The buffet brakfasts were a good mixture of English/Continental and the hot chocolate drink, scrumptious, I thoroughly recommend this hotel to all discerning travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average room”
Reviews.Author: Onyxsoleil
Reviews.Content: We waited until the last minute to book our Venice hotel so we were limited in our choices since we wanted to stay in San Marco. The location was good for drop off (vaporetto from train station) and great for catching the vaporetto to the airport. We were also centrally located for seeing Venice and great shops in the immediate area. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The rooms were very average. The bed creaked with every move and was not comfortable. Bathroom was very pink and outdated. The room was rather stuffy with no air conditioning, we did not open the windows due to the gnats and mosquitoes. The breakfast buffet was decent but super busy since the hotel accomodates cruise ship passengers. Free wifi was nice but only seemed to work in the lobby but at least it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff at a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: PAPADUCKS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of a Princess cruise.Having never been to Venice we did't know what to expect in terms getting from the hotel to the places we wanted to see.Wow, we were pleasently surprised. Arriving and departing from the rear door by water taxi was a breeze. The Front Desk and Princess Rep. were most helpful. The rooms are ALL different, so if you don't like the one you get, just ask for a change. They're as accomodating as possible. The room came with a Buffet breakfast which was sufficient. All in all we would gladly stay at the Saturnia again.

Reviews.Title: “a difficult review to write!”
Reviews.Author: 29cah
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel I have stayed where the concierge asked me to write a review so here goes! This holiday was a present for my 60th birthday from my husband, we booked through AA Getaways, we had seen an offer in the Times newspaper; I read the reviews about the hotel and on the advice of one emailed the hotel telling the hotel that it was a 60th birthday and was it possible to have 'beautiful quiet room with a big bed and a fantastic bathroom'. This of course was only a request but can you imagine when we arrived we were given the tiniest room possible!! We asked if there was another bigger room as we were staying for a week, we were given a room overlooking a courtyard used for rubbish and deliveries. The bed creaked so badly we kept waking each other up at night and then in the morning we were woken by staff moving crates and rubble and rubbish and shouting at each other. Breakfast is very ordinary, scrambled eggs and greasy bacon everyday plus the usual cold meat and cheese not historic at all. Over our room there was constant banging we guessed renovation which explained the movement of rubble all day every day. Internet well that is funny, it is free but we had to go and get a different number everyday and one for each p.c., and find a place where it worked, please this should be free to all and in every room in this day and age. So my review is not brilliant, I was expecting the bottle of Prosecco and the Jacuzzi but we had a great week in Venice the sun shined everyday on the most beautiful city! The hotel is in a great position, the staff are wonderful, helpful and funny too, Andrea the concierge is an absolute treasure, he should be running the hotel, always very knowledgeable and advised where to go and where not to go he also gave us tickets to La Fenise which was a great experience thank you Andrea.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights of magic”
Reviews.Author: crusinKate
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of a two week trip from London to Venice, our neice was getting married in Venice and we added 3 days on to our trip to experience Venice.. this was a beautiful hotel, it has old world charm, one feels that one steps back into time, the concierge was very helpful, the breakfast was delicious, our room was beautiful, it had a sitting area where one could sit outside, that was just lovely, Venice was my least favorite city throught Europe but if one makes a stop in Venice, I HIGHLY recommend this very elegant hotel..should we go back we would love to try the restaurant, it was rated very highly and looked beautiful.. Our room over looked the street below and was a bit noisey till we closed the beautiful drapes, the wood floor was beautiful, I highly recommend this hote.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Hotel with a Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: heartstoyou
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful 100 year old family-owned hotel on Larga XXII Marzo. It's location is situated directly across from many of Venice's high-end shops and art galleries. Walk out the door of the hotel, turn left, cross over one bridge with a gondola station, and continue on a bit and you will arrive at Piazza San Marco. Turn right, and go over a couple of bridges and through a couple of squares and you will arrive at Campo San Stefano and the Accademia Bridge. The rooms are spacious and nicely appointed and the staff is incredibly helpful. The breakfast buffet will not disappoint you as it has a wide variety of offerings to help you prepare for a day of sightseeing or shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned charm, decor and service”
Reviews.Author: normalinnorfolk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five day stay at the Hotel Saturnia & International taken via AA Getaways and would thoroughly recommend this hotel as a charming additional to any Venetian holiday and not just somewhere to stay. The Saturnia is centrally located about equal distance from San Marco in one direction and the Grand Canal in the other and in a very upmarket area. However, once you entered the hotel it was an oasis of peace and tranquillity. The staff were exceedingly helpful and outstandingly knowledgeable but not intrusive - our lovely, well furnished and appointed Art Deco, en suite room was quiet and kept spotlessly clean by the housekeeping staff. Breakfast was served for a longer period than one would normally expect, which proved helpful. A good and plentiful selection which was constantly replenished by the efficient and attentive staff. Only a shortish walk from the water bus stop at San Marco - turn left not right (as we did) when you exit the terminus and then about a five minute walk away. A complimentary bottle of wine to revive us was cooling on ice when we arrived in our room. There was so much to see within a few minutes of the hotel location. Probably the best hotel we have ever stayed at, quite uniquely charming and with a delightfully, old fashioned standard of service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old Italian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cathyinwv
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in an Italian hotel and we loved the Saturnia. While it is an older hotel, it is very well maintained. Our room and bath were roomy and nice and very clean. Our room overlooked a canal and I was worried about unpleasant odors, as I had read reviews of Venice complaining of the smell of garbage, but we never experienced that. Our bed was very comfortable, not too hard as I experienced later in the trip. Breakfast was included and very good. The hotel is located around some upscale shops and a short walk to St. Mark's Square.

Reviews.Title: “Superb situation in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tom F
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a package with AA Getaways for the size of its rooms and the location. It turned out to be really comfortable. The staff [especially those on the front desk] were outstandingly friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Our room was really spacious, very warm and well equipped. The complimentary bottle of well iced prosecca that we found in our room on arrival was most welcome. The room had a large safe [no extra charge], large screen TV, well supplied bathroom and was really really quiet. The inclusive breakfast offered a good choice of food and drink. The hotel is very close to St Marks Square and even closer to La Fenice opera house [we recommend the tours of the fabulous building for 8 euros]. The shops and restaurants nearby were beyond our price range but hugely entertaining. We strolled across the Academia bridge [and elsewhere] to find more affordable establishments. The 72 hour Vaporetti pass was good value and we absolutely loved our trip up to Torcello.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: poppy186408
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we have stayed in, so close to everything and yet surprisingly quiet. The hotel and our room were beautifully decorated with lots attention to detail and everything was spotlessly clean. We requested a room with a view and were pleased to get one with a good view of the canal and were able to watch the gondolas going about their business, delivering fruit and vegetables or collecting the rubbish from the restaurant opposite and also watching the tourists enjoying their ride.The workers do start early in the morning and you may get some noise but that didn't bother us. Our towels were changed daily and even the pillow cases changed. Our bathroom had a walk-in shower which we found very useful. All the staff were so friendly and helpful they couldn't do enough for us. Breakfast was self service and very good, again the staff were very friendly and efficient. We highly recommend this hotel and would definately stay there again.Thank you Hotel Saturnia for a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great loaction”
Reviews.Author: richardhodgson
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very friendly and helpful concierge

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jeff N
Reviews.Content: The Saturnia Hotel is a charming throwback type of hotel. It is a mix of the old world (I think the building is more than 500 years old) with the new-the bathrooms are completely modern. The rooms are more than adequate - certainly not the luxury you will experience at a modern hotel, but they are very clean and were fine for the 2 nights of our stay. The location is excellent, as you are only a 2 minute walk to St. Mark's Square but yet it is quiet enough not to be bothered. The breakfasts are good, although not exceptional and the service is very personal. From the time you get off of the water taxi at the back of the hotel and check in at the old style desk (with real keys-nothing electronic) to the concierge(s) taking an interest in your plans, you are in a very different, and interesting world. The negatives are the lack of view-disappointing to be in Venice and not face water- and the difficulty if you need to use wireless as I had to go to a specific place in a lounge to access my email. I'm not sure if the Staurnia is a good value as it certainly is not inexpensive, but everything in Venice seems to be priced high. We absolutely loved our time in Venice and the Saturnia was a good home base for us.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay here...”
Reviews.Author: Mannie79
Reviews.Content: Positives: great location, big room, pleasant staff, cute courtyard with breakfast included. Negatives: pricey (but what isn't in Venice) & no view. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay at this property. The staff was very attentive and helpful, breakfast was enjoyable in the courtyard (coffee rocked!), and since it was centrally located, we had no problems navigating the streets of Venice and finding our way back to our temporary home. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm M
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel in a quiet location that is a short distance away from Piazza San Marco, San Marco Vallaresso vaporeto landing stage, and La Fenice. Very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms large, but as is usual in Italy, a bit dark with wooden floors, and of course, no tea/coffee facilities. Excellent breakfast, and a very good attached restaurant. There is also an excellent osteria (Vino Vino) just round the corner on the way to La Fenice. The Accademia bridge is just a few minutes walk away. There are so many things to see and do in Venice and the Concierge was most helpful with his suggestions and advice. It would be difficult to find a better hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of heaven in Venice”
Reviews.Author: gailg13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the good fortune to have been booked by our travel agent into this perfectly located hotel at the end of a luxurious cruise. We could not have hoped for better service. Andrea Scarpa, the gracious concierge, greated us warmly at 9:15 AM and had us into our spacious, quiet room by 9:45. My brother and sister-in-law were with us but only for the day, having train tickets to leave Venice that evening. Andrea helped arrange for their bags to be stored, made an early dinner reservation for the four of us, and arranged their transportation to the train station, even though they were not actual guests at the hotel. We had our own angst about needing transportation to get us to the airport on the morning we were leaving With a 7:05 AM flight, Andrea took care of ordering a wake-up call for us at 4:15 AM, a prompt, private water taxi for 4:45 AM, a porter to handle our luggage and even made sure that a bagged breakfast had been packed to keep us nourished on the first leg of our long trip home to the Bay Area. If I ever am lucky enough to return to Venice, I'll be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Visit”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth W
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Hotel Saturnia. The staff made us feel welcome and at home. They were very helpful with directions and ideas of places to go. The room was light and well furnished and the bathroom was fine. The location is great - in the center of things, but away from all the crowds. I highly recommend the hotel and can't wait til our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: JIMCOLEMN
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Saturnia for two nights following a cruise. The room was large and well maintained for an older hotel. The staff was very friendly and provided good suggestions for close by restaurants that were less expensive than La Carravalle. Breakfast was good and service was excellent. The front desk arranged both a gondola ride and water taxi to the airport for us. The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Zoeycat
Reviews.Content: When I read some of these reviews I feel as if I must have stayed at a totally different hotel! Our 2 nights at the Saturnia were pretty bad. We got one of those rooms that have a small sitting area and bathroom downstairs, and the bed was in a loft upstairs. Our "view" was of a tiny courtyard which looked directly into the windows on the other side of the courtyard. Luckily we only had two small windows and the window shades didn't open on either so we didn't see anybody and nobody saw us. The people at the front desk were tolerant, that's the best I can say. They acted as if we were a necessary evil and I quickly learned to avoid them at all costs. BTW they were all men; we never saw this woman everybody raves about. They did offer us a complimentary excursion to Murano as our room was not ready when we checked in but we had already booked one for the following day so we didn't go. We had just come off a cruise ship and did not have an electricity converter but in our travels we have discovered that most hotels have them. I called the front desk and asked if they did and they said yes I could come get one, and "madam, would you pleeeeze stop pulling the alarm cord". What? I figured I just didn't understand him cuz I had no idea what he was talking about. Come to find out my husband had pulled an alarm cord in the bathroom looking for a way to turn the fan on. (The fan that did not work AT ALL. Oh it made a noise but the minute you turned the shower on all the mirrors fogged up and stayed that way till you opened the door.) My husband picked up the converter from the front desk, brought it up and tried to make it work. He got a nasty shock from it, couldn't get it to work and asked if they had another. They said it was all they had and we went out and bought our own. The shower was almost unusable. There was no way to set the water temperature which went in short intervals from cold to super-hot. So I took a cold-ish shower, having to literally step out of the shower each time the hot cycle came around. It was ridiculous. The bed was hard and so were the pillows. The lighting up in that loft was not enough to read a book. The couch in the sitting room was so delapidated you could hardly sit in it. And the zipper on one of the cushion covers was broken so the cover would slip off making it even harder to sit. We went up to the roof looking for the drinks and snacks other people have talked about but all that was up there were sun lounges. It was a nice little area but no evidence of drinks or snacks. Maybe it's a seasonal thing, although we were there in September, it was still good and hot and the tourist season supposedly goes thru the end of October, but whatever. There was no breakfast in the outdoor restaurant either; inside only, and the breakfast was not remarkable. There are only two good things I have to say about Saturnia; the location is great and they offer free wi-fi. I'm sure I can find these two things AND a decent bed and shower somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Staff so helpful”
Reviews.Author: Charlie4243
Reviews.Content: We always stay at The Saturnia when we come to Venice. This time was different as my partner is now confind to a wheelchair. The room was spacious and had plenty of room to get around,especially in the bath/shower room(walk-in shower no lip). Also the staff were fantastic,special praise to the porters who help us over bridge to allow us to get to the waterbus. Fantastic breakfast even better resturant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: KrissyKolb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 2 nights here in mid-September and were very, very pleased. The location was perfect to explore all of Venice and the front desk staff was very helpful. they coordinated a trip to Murano island and a gondola ride for us and the breakfasts that were included with our room stay were very good. The room was large and the entire hotel was unique and interesting. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and service”
Reviews.Author: fjchorroc
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Saturnia was a wonderful place to spend in Venice. There for 4 nights and found the old hotel very accomodating. Rooms were very nice, old but very nice and the staff was found to be very wonderful. Always willing to show directions, make recommends for resturaunts and ideas around the city. If you are looking for an authentic experience in Venice, this is the place for you. The hotel has been run by the same family since 1913, and the owners are there in the office every day. Special thanks to Andrea on the front desk, the best at making us feel like we were not just dumb tourists but guests in this special gem of a hotel, no snobby staff here. You can not go wrong with this Hotel, on a main road to San Marco, just a very short walk along the local area were all the great shops are. Worth the price. Charm does not get better than this! If we do travel to Venice again, we will certainly be staying at the Hotel Saturnia.

Reviews.Title: “Very old with racial discrimination waiter”
Reviews.Author: Emily C
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel is located on the main street in Venice, and the front desk staffs are very friendly, the room furniture is very old with noise and I had my worst breakfast in the hotel. When I entered the restaurant in that morning, because my husband and I brought lots of bags, and there were almost full, we picked a four-persons table for breakfast and some other couples also sat at four-persons tables at that time. However, when we started to eat, one waiter kept asking us to change to a very small two-persons table. I told him that others also sat at four-persons table, and asked him, why do we only need to change? Even one white-couple sat at four-persons table next to us. He just said there will another two people and he still insisted that we need to change. He even retrieved two sets of cup from our table. However, till we finished the terrible breakfast, there were still no other person joined the white-couple next to us. This is the worst breakfast that I had in my life. I will never choose this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Hkat1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Saturnia for 4 nights this September. Nice, large rooms and bathrooms, and very clean. Good free wifi service. The staff of the hotel and restaurant were very accommodating, and took care of all requests promptly. Great location for accessing all areas of Venice. Nice breakfast buffet, and we also had a very good dinner at La Caravella one evening. Overall great value for Venice and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our first Wedding Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: Marc E
Reviews.Content: Our first hotel cancelled on us with just a month to go, after booking nearly a year in advance!so we hoped to find somewhere as good so late on And yes, did this hotel deliver! We got room 206, small canal view, huge room, very large double bath, walk in shower and very well set out Customer service here is very good, excellent staff at reception, they will do anything to help, whether orgainsing restaurants, advice on trips, when to go etc they deliver! ps always book any popular restaurant a day before as you probably wont get in by turning up The hotel booked a free water taxi ride to Murano to view the glassware, we also took the trip up to Burano, a very pretty quiet island, famous for lace and coloured houses with a feel of a fishing village The restaurant at the hotel la caravello, a very good in guide books restaurant, is in a very nice garden room in good weather and a timber framed room otherwise both very nice and the decent continental breakfast served in the courtyard The hotel, although 4 star is medium priced and was great value compared to some we were quoted Also the hotel is based just off the beaten track, a few minutes walk to San Marco and right on a top designer shopping street! Gondala`s nearby too, taking you through the quiter backwater canals, best to go after 6pm, when the cruise ship clients are gone All in all a great last minute find and a great wedding anniversary trip!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it and hope to return!”
Reviews.Author: armadia
Reviews.Content: Our 3 nights (before taking a 12 day cruise) at The Hotel Saturnia/International were FABULOUS. We spent our honeymoon here 27 years ago, and it remains a gem. The hotel has been renovated since our last visit, but the friendly and positive family-run attitude has not changed a bit. Everyone treated us like royalty, and couldn't be nicer. We had a super special room with a bathroom that we wished we could take home! As repeat customers, they really rolled out the red carpet for us: flowers in the room and a bottle of Prosecco to enjoy on our little terrace. The rooms are very comfortable, and the bathroom is a very good size with hair dryer and complimentary shampoo, conditioner and body lotion. Each room has a safe and refrigerator. The hotel is air conditioned and our room overlooked the main street but there was absolutely no noise. There is a roof terrace with chairs and tables, and one night we had wine and appetizers up there. Just wonderful! The concierge, Andrea, was a real gem. He had arranged a private water taxi to pick us up at the airport and bring us to their private dock -- easy, peasy. Since we were 4 people, this was definitely the way to go. We also had him arrange a private taxi to the ship -- again, they pulled up right at the Saturnia dock and whisked us away. Breakfast was included and was served out in a lovely garden with excellent service and lots of meats, breads, rolls, hard boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, bacon, cereals, yogurts, juices, etc. Also, DELICIOUS coffee and cappuccino! There is no other hotel in Venice for us to consider in the future except The Saturnia!

Reviews.Title: “High Priced and Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: dmgsolon
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a great location just a short walk from the Vaparetto Line 1 S. Maria di Guilio stop. You can walk to Piazza San Marco in less than 3 minutes. The hotel is sprawling with nice sitting areas and it has elevators. There is a pretty garden area in the restaurant where breakfast is served with both hot and cold items. The front desk staff is helpful and courteous. And there is free internet. Our family had 2 triple rooms which were spacious with a large bathroom and a sink area separate from the bathtub and shower area. Both of the rooms were clean, but had poor ventilation and a foul odor. Furnishings were antique and beds were hard with a spring mattress over a board on the bedframe. I stayed in a Venice B&B last year and it was so much better!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Davo_Fido
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Venice before so I researched hotels using TripAdvisor and found the reviews very accurate. The best thing of all about this hotel is the very friendly and helpful staff on the front desk.Absolutely nothing was too mch trouble. For example, my bag was lost by BA and the hotel chased it up for me. After returning to the hotel after our first day of sight seeing my bag was in my room. Another example, I purchased from the hotel a three day ferry ticket but when I didn't use it, the hotel happily bought it back off me. The next best thing about the Saturnia is it's close location to San Marco Square. Some may prefer a "room with a view" over the Grand Canal but if this is not important, the Saturnia's central location offers ease of access to most attractions. Our tariff included a buffet breakfast which was of high quality and would offer something to everyone except the fussiest of palates. The accommodation itself is what I would call "quaint". Remember this building (like all of Venice) is a few hundred years old so expect a few squeaks and it's not roomy by modern standards but everything was clean and tidy and worked and when you're only using the room basically to sleep in in order to recover for another day of heavy duty sightseeing how much room do you really need? Oh, and if you ask the guy at the counter to arrange something for you and he replies in a heavy Italian accent "Too easy mate", that's my fault as I taught him some Australianisms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- great location”
Reviews.Author: sroch59
Reviews.Content: 2 couples stayed here for 2 days prior to a cruise. The rooms (205 and 206) were very large and comfortable. Large bathroom. The price was 153E per night if booked directly with hotel. The desk were very polite and helpful.. They referred us to a reasonably priced restaurant nearby and arranged for watertaxis from airport and to cruise ship. One of the couples did not get their luggage and the desk was very helpful in retrieving it. Breakfast was included and was a nice buffet served in an courtyard. Overall this was the best hotel we ever stayed at in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Gaston m
Reviews.Content: I had read some negative review about this hotel. However, in my case, it was one of the best places I had the privilege of staying for four nights. I dealt with three â€œconciergesâ€� during my stay to answer my many questions about directions and how to do this and that in Venice. Even if they were very busy they were most helpful, as they should be, but also very patient and in excellent English. My preference went to Giovanni. The staff at breakfast was very attentive and helpful. One lady serving even remembered I had tea every morning. One aspect I didnâ€™t, personally, enjoy was the little birds sometimes picking at your food while I was away at the buffet table. The food was varied, abundant and good. My single room was small but cosy and without noise. The floor could, I thought, have been cleaner, but it was a minor detail. The hotel is ideally located within walking minutes from what many tourists care about, i.e., the centre of attractions in Venice, the Piazza San Marco. It is also within easy minutes from vaporetto stops for all destinations. Finally, the hotel interior is very nice with its dark beams. The Internet connection could be faster. Gaston.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming.”
Reviews.Author: jantor07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Venice and a stay at Hotel Saturnia. Our only regret...that we only stayed at the Hotel Saturnia for one night. The location was central to everything we wanted to see, the entire staff was friendly and helpful. Andrea, the concierge, was extremely helpful and the older gentleman (whose name, unfortunately, I have forgotten) was charming. He spoke no English, our Italian was limited, but we did find out that he had been at the Hotel Satunia for 41 years... what a tribute to the owners of this hotel. This is not the Holiday Inn, nor is it the Hilton. It is a charming mixture of old and new, modern and old-fashioned. The building dates from the 15thc and the hotel has operated for 100 yearsOur bathroom was lovely and totally up-to-date, our bedroom had a beautiful headboard that could have been early 20th century,. The front desk still had pigeon holes for messages and metal keys that were held by the front desk while you were out.; but internet and fax services were available if needed. Our room had a small balcony that overlooked the garden restaurant, roofs of nearby buildings and a bell tower. The air-conditioning worked well, even when temps reached 100 degrees. The hotel had its own canal entrance which made arrival and departure very easy (Note however, that the water taxi is very expensive, which is not the hotel's fault). We had a lovely breakfast in their garden restaurant, but did not have an opportunity to have dinner at the hotel. We will return to Venice and we will, most definitely, stay at the Hotel Saturnia!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience !!!!”
Reviews.Author: NancyC08
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotal Saturnia in Venice was amazing. The service was impeccable and the staff pleasant, helpful and friendly. The Consierge services were the best we have ever experienced. We celebrated our anniversary while in Venice and were given a lovely upgraded room overlooking the canal and a bottle of champagne was present in our room upon arrival. The room was well appointed and the bathroom large and well equipped. The attention to energy conservation sets a great example for other hotels to follow. The location of Saturnia can't be beat......a very short walk to San Marco as well as all the other points of interest. Restaurants, banks and shops are just out the front door. And....the buffet breakfast was fantastic !!! Highly recommend the Hotel Saturnia !!!

Reviews.Title: “Quality staff ensure that this "secret" hotel stands out”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: As is the case with most of the hotels in Venice, one could easily walk past the main entrance without knowing it was there. Once inside the authentic traditional style of this quaint hotel is very apparent. The Reception/Concierge staff are very friendly and helpful in every way. Their are a few gems like the sun terrace on the fourth floor, and the courtyard restaurant, but don't expect any fabulous views because of the very central location right in the heart of the city. The rooms are comfortable, spacious, and well presented, but no tea making facilities. The restaurant staff are excellent, one has to pay for quality food and service but nothing comes cheap in Venice because everything has to come in by boat. The restaurant Maitre D'hotel, Nicole, was exemplary and made us very welcome, as did all of his staff, the food and service was quite excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with amazing serviceand friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: jwaite1
Reviews.Content: After reading a couple of reviews regarding staff I was unsure what to expect! All I can say is that we were both amazed at how wonderful the hotel was. The staff were outstanding and able to answer any question we threw at them. The room was beautiful with a great view of a canal so we could watch gondolas down below. Overall it was perfect for our honeymoon and we hope to return!

Reviews.Title: “Top service at a top hotel”
Reviews.Author: janet_totham
Reviews.Content: The service we received made our holiday in Venice a fabulous experience. My husband uses a wheelchair and all the staff at the hotel, management, restaurant, reception, room service etc etc were extra vigilant in helping whenever they could. Our holiday was to celebrate our Ruby Anniversary and we were not disappointed. The room was extremely spacious (we upgraded to a superior room for extra space) and the atmosphere in this ancient hotel lent itself to its long history. Reception gave us a leisure map and were able to guide us on access on the many places we visited. We even managed a gondola trip! The jacuzzi bath kept switching itself on and off after we first used it - we had to ask someone to show us how to turn it off. There was another switch on the wall next to the bathroom door which had to be turned off after each use - a small note in the bathroom would have made life a bit easier in this respect. The hotel restaurant food was exceptionally good backed up by superb waiting and wine pouring. There is a fabulous sun terrace on the roof with sun loungers, chairs and tables etc and of course a fabulous view of Venice rooftops. We recommend the hotel thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: hopelands
Reviews.Content: check in : quick and efficient . the room was not ready , and the receptionist suggested lunch at hotel's garden restaurant . after a look at the prices for lunch , we decided to eat at restaurant around the corner . room : a superior deluxe room - comfortable room overlooking a canal on one side and rooftops on the other. a separtae annexe with a desk and chair , and the room itself which was attractively furnished . the bathroom appeared to be recently refurbished and was quite modern with a large walk in shower breakfast : a continental breakfast was served in the garden courtyard - a decent selection , and great coffee . staff were friendly and always around to serve more coffee

Reviews.Title: “Extremely rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo-7
Reviews.Content: I never stayed at this hotel. I made a reservation through email and had to cancel a few days after. I wrote an email to the hotel address. The girl (owner's daughter as she insisted to say) said she had nothing, and "Not a real reservation otherwise you should have something clearer in your hands... I suppose" or, when I said that if I had no reservation I had nothing to cancel... she said "Ok, as per your wishes. Just take note that in case you have a reservation at home (made through e-mail, internet, agecny or whatever ) and you do not cancell it within the terms in case of no show a fee will be charged. This is the reason why I would suggest you to take the time to check, but it's up to you." I think the girl describes by herself...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place with a great concierge!”
Reviews.Author: 6Durbs
Reviews.Content: All of the other reviewers who loved this hotel have already highlighted its many 5 star qualities--the central location, the impeccable cleanliness, the delicious breakfasts, and the relative size of the rooms. But I also wanted to make sure that any guests of this hotel take advantage of the knowledge and friendliness of Andrea, the concierge who can seemingly help five different guests at the same time--speaking 5 different languages! He is patient, to the point, and full of great insights into this magical city. Thanks again, Andrea!

Reviews.Title: “great location + service, but average rooms”
Reviews.Author: ewa55555
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in very busy touristic area. The staff is very friendly and nice, but our room was not exactly 4*..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: MA_Browne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is deserving of its good rating. The multilingual staff are very welcoming and first rate. It's bang next to Venice's most expensive shopping district, very quiet at night. To get there from the airport, simply get the Alilaguna water bus to San Marco. From there it's only a 5 minute walk (over two small bridges if you're pulling suitcases) to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel in San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Cymru2011
Reviews.Content: Ah Venice, I am in love! I will be back. We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Conveniently located in San Marco. For luggage that is sightseeing in Venice it is two bridges from a Vaporetto stop. Nice breakfast included in our rate. Backs on a side canal. We took the Aliguna to the Airport next time we will take a water taxi definitely worth the splurge from what we saw! Stayed on in Venice after a cruise. A nice hotel with extremely professional staff. Would stat again. I miss you Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel...will return again”
Reviews.Author: ScoSte
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel while on a small group tour with QueensLander Tours. It has an old-world European charm to it, and is centrally located off of one of the high-end shopping districts of Venice. Just a short walk to the famed San Marco Square with easy access to restaurants, cafes, etc. My room was very spacious and decorated with antique furniture and windows that opened over the canal. I visited some of the other rooms, and they all seemed to have a unique decor and feel, but all were nicely appointed. The front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating. There is a bar just off the main lobby where Nicolai, the hotel maitre 'd, can prepare you a great coffee. He is very knowlegeable about coffee and can prepare just about anything you like. The hotel chef is also very good with preparing unique chocolate desserts to complement your selection. I also remember the morning breakfast in the restaurant to be quite sufficient, with eggs and bacon, or lighter fare if you prefer boiled eggs, cereal, yogurt, etc. I will definitely stay at this hotel again when in Venice! You really can't beat the location and overall quality.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ColoTraveler2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Venice, and at the recommendation of our travel agent, stayed at the Hotel Saturnia. We were thrilled with our room and the hotel. The hotel was centrally located to many things and very lovely. Our room was fabulous! Very large (based on other hotels we stayed at in Italy) with a great bed and a bathroom with not only a nice large shower, but a tub and two sinks. The air conditioner in the room worked like a dream (another thing we didn't see often in Italy) and was a welcome relieft after a long, hot day spent exploring the city. We especially appreciated the gentlemen at the front desk (sorry, but we can't remember their names!). Especially the gentleman who was on duty when we checked in. We were hot and tired after traveling that day. He was very kind, allowed up to get settled, then recommended a great restaurant nearby for dinner. He followed up with us the next day to see if we wanted to take a tour and was always polite and helpful. We would certainly stay here again when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “jewel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: sebinus
Reviews.Content: Second stay here. Incredible location,very god restaurant and a very good staff. Outstanding concierge service. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cindylow88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at room 401 which is next to terrace. Quite warm at night; could be due to the summer heat. Very clean and spacious. The floors creaked as we walked around, bit of a disturbance. The location is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful and unique building, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: WoodyLLeawood_KS
Reviews.Content: We thouroghly enjoyed our stay there. Our room was beautiful, and the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: gsully1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thru Princess Cruises for a pre-cruise stay in Venice. It is a beautiful hotel, beautiful room and bathroom. I haven't seen a nicer bathroom anywhere! Breakfasts were more than adequate. The restaurant in the hotel is a great place to eat dinner. The hotel is an easy walk from St. Marks square and the Rialto bridge. I would highly recommend this hotel and would love to visit venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, very professional and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Aleshel
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the beautiful Ca Pisani hotel when visiting Venice, however, I am happy to say it was fully booked at the time of my trip. I was kindly re-directed to the Hotel Saturnia, owned by the same family, and was able to book a room there. There are quite a few similarities between the two hotels, all of them good. The service is always extremely friendly and charming, and both hotels have wonderful Italian style, The Ca Pisani has a more contemporary feel but The Saturnia mixes both the ancient and modern well. There is a also a lovely relaxed restaurant serving delicious modern Italian cuisine and a roof terrace overlooking central Venice, but most importantly I think as a solo traveller it is worth again mentioning the wonderful welcome and service I received from all the staff. I hope to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LinderLoo
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel. It was in a quieter area but so close to San Marco square. The hotel exceeded our expecations and the service was amazing. The concierge was fabulous! Andrea Scarpa made our stay so memorable - he was fantastic! Extremely attentive with great recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Cindy81096
Reviews.Content: I loved Venice and this hotel for it's charm and wonderful staff. The room was clean and the bathroom had counter space to put your toiletries on. The window opened up to a view of the street and all of the shops nearby. The continental breakfast was very good and the wait staff were very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY STAY AT THE VERY CHARMING HOTEL SATURNIA VENEZIA”
Reviews.Author: Italexplorer
Reviews.Content: Recently I organized a trip throughout Italy for my family and myself; although I have been several times to Venice and all throughout Italy for my family members; it was their first time. I therefore had to chose carefully the various places we visited and most importantly the hotels. I could not have chosen a better hotel than The Hotel Saturnia in Venice. Firstly the Hotel is situated in an absolutely prime location; steps away from St. Mark's Square as well as the Bridge to the Accademia and not far from The Rialto Bridge as well. The Hotel is also located right on the very best street for shopping and viewing all of the typical Venetian passageways and craft shops. The interior of the Hotel is quite charming and historic; dating back to the 16th and 17th centuries with original tile, mosaics, furnishings and art work. The Guest Rooms are very spacious and offer a variety of shapes and sizes; some offer canal views and some have quite opulent and ornate palazzo type furnishings while others have more of an art deco style but all are quite lovely and spacious. The staff are warm and friendly and make you feel at home. The very lovely restaurant La Caravella is most beautiful day and night and is situated in a garden filled courtyard within the Hotel. A very nice Breakfast Buffet is served there al fresco each morning; weather permitting. Most important and most important for any visitor and hotel guest; Andrea Scarpa the Chef Concierge of The Hotel Saturnia is one of the best in the business; if not The Best!! Not only is he so well connected and knowledgeable of Venice but one feels as though he is your best friend!! Andrea is a member of Les Clefs d'Or (The Golden Keys) symbolic of the ultimate service in friendship!! I highly recommend The Hotel Saturnia in Venice to anyone and most importantly; you will love meeting Andrea The Chef Concierge!!

Reviews.Title: “Would look for a different hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: ahvazi028
Reviews.Content: The location is not bad, about 5 minutes walk from the water bus stop and Saint Mark's Square. However, there are better located and more modern 4* hotels in Venice. We were given a welcome complimentary bottle of wine. Some stuff were helpful and friendly although had a tendency to be rude at times. The room was large but noisy from the main road just outside and with some mosquitoes. It was clean enough, as were the linen and bath towels. The room furniture was very cumbersome and heavy. They had stacked too much old and useless furniture in the room. It had a large and reasonably adequate bathroom with a basic hairdryer but no makeup mirror. There was a safe in the room with slippers. Buffet breakfast was adequate although the same every day.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jacbri
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay in Venice. I have traveled to Venice 5 times and this hotel as by far the best rooms in Venice. Although not directly on the Grand Canal, it is within close proximity, and the rooms are second to none. Great value for your money and the staff is helpful and courteous. You will be happy that you chose this hotel. You need to look no further than this hotel. I booked a large room and it was fantastic. I plan on going again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ggb1945
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in a wonderful location. The staff was excellent and very responsive. Ask for a room facing the canal. It's quieter (except in the afternoon when the gondoliers float by, singing their wonderful songs).

Reviews.Title: “Look at options other than Hotel Saturnia”
Reviews.Author: rsoltes
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Saturnia was mediocre at best. The room they gave us was VERY small, outdated and smelled terrible. All of the furniture & walls were beat up, our sheets were dirty (both days we were there) and the bathroom-although more updated than the rest of the room-smelled so bad we could barely use it. The staff was fairly rude. After checking in and seeing the room, we asked for a new one. To their credit they DID immediately show us a new one...but it was WORSE than the initial room they had given to us. Another inconvenience is they also charge for every 3 hours of internet useage...and it can only be accessed from the first floor...AND they shut it off at midnight. I would recommend against staying at the Hotel Saturnia. It is very expensive, yet not very nice at all. There are tons of other hotels in Venice that are similarly priced, but will actually make it worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: danstar68
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 5 nights for a conference nearby.
