The conference was on Lido but we chose to stay in main Venice for the true Venice feel despite the 20min vaporetto ride to the conference centre. It is a wonderful hotel with plenty of history and charm which has been kept despite it being renovated to more modern standards. Paid for WiFi is still unreliable however. When it worked it was great. The location is almost perfect (not right on Grand Canal - I was a bit jealous of people elsewhere having their breakfasts on terraces along the canals), on a beautiful shopping street, between 2 vaporetto stops/lines, close to San Marco's piazza. It has its own water landing - perfect for leaving by taxi with full luggage! Breakfast was good - nice coffees and all the usual fare. Our room was large by Venice standards with a great rainshower tucked away in a quite corner. The only noise we heard was when a large electrical storm hit Venice one night. All staff were nice and helpful in their own unique ways. Breakfast staff could occasionally be a bit short. The hotel has a lot of areas to sit and relax in including a rooftop area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not over whelming”
Reviews.Author: Emmy44
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, and in a good location. It was very clean, and well decorated. Throughout our stay the staff were pleasant, formal and efficient, rather then friendly, welcoming and personal. Our room was clean, and nice, not modern, or outstanding in anyway, just a nice, clean room. The bathroom though, was fantastic!! Huge, deep jacuzzi bath, fantastic shower, and decorated really modern. Would I stay here again.......unlikely, I prefer staff that are alittle less stuffy!, which is a shame because I can't really pin point any huge fails for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A small and very cordial hotel ideally situated for walking in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: PJanicke
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location on a side canal three minutes' walk from San Marco makes it very accessible to travellers. The front is on a pedestrian street that abounds in restaruants, cafes, and shops. The rooms on the canal side are quieter, with only the occasional gondola singer heard as he passes by. The staff is very friendly and helpful in every regard, so you feel at home there from the first day. The hotel has its own restaurant and bar for those who don't want to venture out for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadnonstop
Reviews.Content: We stayed there to celebrate our anniversary, and they upgraded us to a corner suite. Very nice...also provided Champagne and a nice note in our room. In early evening you could hear the gondolas go buy, with their singing, under the window. Very romantic. The front desk was very helpful....gave us a map and suggested a way to see venice. Also arranged a private visit to a small family glass company in Murano...we had a wonderful time. Ate in the restaurant...very good. This place is a gem, and the management has a great attitude of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Could - and should - have been a better experience”
Reviews.Author: bidoogiri
Reviews.Content: Having been a frequent guest at the Saturnia's sister hotel (Ca'Pisani), and having always enjoyed my stays there, I was disappointed to be turned away by them. I was surprised they did not point me to Saturnia, given the common ownership. I happened to remember they had another property, and literally stumbled upon two available rooms. The entire experience can be encapsulated in one phrase: "could have been great, but wasn't." They know - or should know - that I come to Venice not once, but multiple times a year, that I have been staying at Ca'Pisani for several years, and have been loyal, and - perhaps most importantly, and perhaps unlike many visitors to Venice - I WILL RETURN! Despite this, the rooms they gave us were tired and old, the service was patchy, often seeming like we were inconveniencing the front desk by asking for something, and often aloof. Having said that, there were glimpses of the service I've come to expect - at our arrival, we were presented a bottle of prosecco, and at our departure the hostess (perhaps an owner) treated us very well. The breakfast buffet was excellent. I'll review the restaurant "La Caravella", where we dined, separately. That too was an experience that fell short of my prior dinners there.

Reviews.Title: “special unique hotel in a magic city”
Reviews.Author: 186340Jean
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 4 nights at this hotel with its discreet service and attention to detail. It is a wonderful restored old building, perfectly situated for sightseeing and shopping, a few minutes from S. Marco Square. We took advantage of the hotel's special arrangements to travel by water taxi for both journeys, to and from the airport, arriving at the hotel's own landing stage. This is costly but worth every euro. Our room was looking over the small canal at the back of the hotel and apart from being serenaded by the gondalas, which was lovely, it was very peaceful and perfect for us. After a breakfast served from 7am, with a good selection, we spent the days shopping and sightseeing all over, with coffee, lunch, tea and wine stops where ever we were. We found suitable restaurants locally to the hotel for the evenings but ate in the hotel's La Caravella Restaurant for our last evening meal, which was wonderful. We enjoyed a cocktail each evening in the American Bar, which we found one day en route to Accadamia Bridge and also a lovely square St. Stefano Square with numerous restaurants and the well known ice cream cafe. We did not use the water buses, preferring to walk, over the canals and getting lost but as we had wonderful weather we stopped for a drink and started again. We enjoyed a gondala ride and visited the Doges' Palace. Venice is expensive but we went prepared and I can't wait to return to Venice and of course the Saturnia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You will not beat location, service or hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: bothlovingflorida
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our last three nights of a nine-night multi-city Italian honeymoon at Hotel Saturnia. The best was definitely kept for last!! Beautiful historical building, with staff extremely helpful, professional and friendly. Great location - 10 minute stroll from San Marco Square, which is the center of all that goes on in Venice. The absolute best highlight was their restaurant, La Caravella. After our first-night dinner experience, we ate their each of the remaining nights, in the garden setting which was gorgeous. The level of service was fabulous, the food wonderful, and the waiters were the greatest team we ever have had! True professionals with great senses of humor and fun banter - terrific! Thank you for a wonderful and memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - 10 out of 10.”
Reviews.Author: MartinH_65
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 6 nights stay for our anniversary. Wonderful location, very close to St. Mark's Square. The bedrooms are large and comfortable and there is a marvelous, huge, lounge on the first floor which takes one back in time. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was more than ample hot/cold buffet and again the waiters were friendly and attentive. We would love to go back to Venice again and we would look no further than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Beautiful rooms and bathrooms - good service”
Reviews.Author: Diane R
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel right in the centre of Venice. Expensive.... yes but all Venice hotels seem to be pricey! Good value for money and definitely worth staying in the central location in our opinion with easy walking access to everywhere! Lovely rooms and beautiful bathrooms. Our room had an upstairs bedroom and two french doors overlooking the canal which was very romantic. The bathroom was well decorated in a neutral marble and everything was very clean and modern. Lovely separate walk in wet shower with separate bath. The room was warm so we had to leave the french doors open at night which did create some noise until after midnight from the hotel opposite the narrow canal we were facing. Service at the main desk was excellent. We could have done with some good restaurant recommendations as although the hotel restaurant looked good we didnt want fine dining though so went to two local restaurants that were absolutely rubbish.... the hotel hadnt recommended these though so it wasnt their fault. Some really good restaurant guidelines for new visitors would be really helpful to avoid guests visiting expensive poor restaurants. Breakfast was only average unfortunately - the best thing about the restaurant was the quality espresso coffee . I asked for an omelette to be made and was told it was possible but I would have to pay extra for this as it wasnt included in the breakfast. In my experience an egg station ordering point at breakfast is pretty normal at breakfast even in European hotels! There was a buffet selection but quality pastries and croissants and fresh breads with an egg station would have really enhanced the breakfast experience. We would stay here again as the hotel is lovely and the service very good, the position is excellent. We used the public transport water system from the airport and although with bags it was a big awkward getting the hotel, we did manage it ok and it ws pretty easy to find. We chose the private water taxi to take us from the hotel landing station though to our ship in the port and this was a much nicer experience .... with luggage!! ..... but a complete rip off - the hotel organised this and gave me a 80 euro price to the port. When we arrived at the ship the taxi driver told us he wanted 10 euros more than this which we had no choice but to pay!!!? The hotel should be aware taxi drivers are doing this again to a captive audience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Silvanalaw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Italy for our 25th Anniversary and our last stop was Venice at this hotel. The service was really good and had the best breakfast from the other 2 hotels we stayed in our trip. I really recommend it. The location is great also.

Reviews.Title: “Andrea, the best Concierge in the World”
Reviews.Author: hfh1982
Reviews.Content: The Saturnia International is a charming, historic hotel in a great location, about three blocks from Saint Mark's square. In one direction is the shopping district and in the other, quiet piazza's, great dining and the local flavors of Venice. The hotel is a refurbished historic villa, and the rooms and common areas are furnished with fine antiques. Imagine staying in an Italian villa in the 19th century, but with 21st centruy amenities! The exceptional service, and in particular that of the chief concierge, Andrea, is what really makes this hotel. The story is too long to tell here, but it involves our daughter's lost passport and the exceptional efforts Andrea and the hotel went to in assisting our family. The personal service was the best of any international or United States hotel at which I have ever stayed. I highly recommend the Saturnia International and its exceptional staff!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- cranky front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: travelguy002
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel well located. We had some issues with the front desk not really accounting for a very warm (80 degree) room during the day and evening. They were 'very surprised' I had problems with noise when we had to keep the window open for the heat. No fans, no air con (starts up in May). WIth the window open we also were bitten by hungry bugs....at least 8 bites on me. Otherwise nice breakfast, great restaurant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JandFF
Reviews.Content: We booked the Saturnia through a travel agency (Amex/Costco) that offered a limited selection of hotels. The Saturnia was their best one. There were many things we liked a lot: the location, three blocks from Piazza San Marco and four blocks from the Giglio vaporetto stop, was unbeatable. The room was very large and easily accommodated the three of us (although they have the smallest shower I have ever used.) The hotel is very quiet and we slept soundly. And the buffet breakfast was top-drawer. However, there were a few things that should not have been. The hotel promises free wi-fi, but the signal is so weak that you can only use your computer in a second-floor living room. The front door to our room was 30 feet away and the signal did not reach. To boot, the wi-fi completely died for a day and a half. Also, the staff at the front desk spends a lot of time at check-in trying to steer you to touristy pursuits (gondola ride, day in Murano, overpriced mediocre restaurant down the street) and that rankled a bit. With a little effort (and an upgraded wireless transmitter) the stay could have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brooks023
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a perfect location. Top quality friendly staff who are happy to help with a smile!Food superb if you eat in. Enjoy venice!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel In A Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: BJU
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Saturnia for 4 nights and found all the staff to be friendly, helpful and welcoming. Our room was spacious and very comfortable. There was plenty of choice at breakfast and this provided a great start to a days sightseeing and exploring. We ate in the hotel (Caravella Restaurant ) for three dinners and the quality of food and service was excellent . The hotel is well positioned for St Marks (about 400m) and the nearest vaparetto stop is about 200m.Getting from the airport is easy - take the No5 bus (every 30mins) outside the airport to Piazzale Roma , then a No1 ( every 10 - 15mins ) Vaparetto down the Grand Canal to St Marco Vallaresso. All this can be done on an ACTV travel pass which is significantly cheaper if bought online beforehand The hotel staff were able to be flexible about check in and out and did their best to accommodate travel arrangements - for example we arrived at noon and were given access to our room straight away and we had a late afternoon flight home and were allowed an extended checkout to 1300. Obviously this cant be guaranteed but it demonstrates a willingness to be helpful All in all the hotel was a pleasure to return to each day and added so much to our enjoyment of beautiful Venice

Reviews.Title: “Characterful Hotel in Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: Whinbrook
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from staying 4 nights at the Saturnia with a group of friends. We got a very keen room rate that not only included breakfast but a complimentary dinner in the hotel's Carvella Restaurant. This deal alone gets 5 stars! The hotel is in a faultless location and we used a private taxi from the airport which took us right to the hotel's canal entrance which is very hidden away. It was an eye watering 120 euros but is the only way to arrive in Venice and between six it was a little less shocking, only just! Rooms varied and our three rooms were quirky and full of character and quite large for Venice. However, I found the beds very uncomfortable - rock hard and too short. The pillows were also like bricks so sleep quality for me was poor. The bathrooms in our three rooms were exceptional however. We had the smallest but it was still beautifully designed and top quality. The rooms were sparcely furnished but all our bed headboards were very over the top and impressive. The decor was very smart (fabric and polished plaster in our room) and in good condition but the other pieces of bedroom furniture looked like they'd been picked up at a flea market. Bedlinens and towels were changed every day even if not needed and good quality. We had a very efficient heated towel rail in the bathroom. Breakfast was very good - plenty of choice, (mostly) hot and cold. We were there over a weekend and the hotel was busy. Guests were turned away at peak breakfast times and told to wait in reception for a table. Not the best arrangement. We were there durning the week too and it was much quieter and relaxed. All the staff were charming and helpful (except one member of the concierge team who was very sullen). Our dinner in La Carvella was excellent. We thought because it was 'complimentary' we would get a fixed menu or a limited choice from the main menu but not the case. We enjoyed it very much. We had reserved a table for 6 well in advance but when we turned up they appeared not to be expecting us and so there was a bit of commotion to get a table for 6 assembled (it is a small restaurant). During the winter season the hotel serves complimentary tea and biscuits in the late afternoon. It was an unexpected and enjoyable bonus. I was mercilessly bitten by mosquitos one night after a heavy day of rain and a mild muggy night, so it might be useful for future visitors to pack some repellent. We kept the window open as the room was (permanently) hot. The A/C appeared not to have been turned on yet while we were there. But we still had a good stay despite finding the city extremely expensive from public transport to a quick coffee in a side street. We went to a evening Vivaldi concert held in a church adjacent to the Accademia Bridge - fully recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a Venice trip.”
Reviews.Author: VegasKnight
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Saturnia was the perfect hotel for our Venice trip. Excellent location, 5 min walk from St. Mark's Sqaure and a nearby Vaporetto (Ferry) stop. The staff was very professional, courteous, and helpful. The rooms are clean, spacious, and comfortable. We'd definitely stay there again for our next trip to Venice. Vaporetto Directions from the Venice Train station : Take the #1 line towards Lido and get off on Vallaresso. Head north and make a left on Sallz da S Moise and continue west. The Saturnia is located right in front of the Burberry store.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Italian Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Lisadiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely. My room was beautiful. The breakfast was terrific. And the location can't be beat. Near to St. Mark's and Rafaele's restaurant (which is amazing!). I would definitely return and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful, Convenient, Fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: PLR2525
Reviews.Content: My wife and two children travelled to Venice for the first time and based on Trip Advisor choose this hotel. We found the location to be perfect. We could be anywhere of importance in Venice in short time yet we felt that the hotel wasn't in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of everything. The food and service at the La Caravella Restaurant located in the hotel is the best I have ever had. (I love really good restaurants and have had the pleasure of dinning at them....La Caravella is simply out of this world.) The hotel serves a good continental breakfast. We found the rooms very spacious. But above all it is always the staff that can make or break a hotel no matter how great the food is or how wonderful the rooms are. Andrea Scarpa the Chef Concierge made our Venice experience a ten out of ten. Andrea knows how to make you feel instantly comfortable and at ease.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were very helpful really helped to make our trip enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: CorkFriends
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very convenient, staff were very professional & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: hp81
Reviews.Content: Stayed only 2 nights with 2 teenagers, Venice is a must see while in Italy. The hotel has renovated bathrooms but bedrooms need a little work. Mattress either hard in our bedroom or really soft in our kids' room. Our rooms were on the 3rd floor away from elevator but it was loud outside- a restaurant below on street and construction on the facade of a neighboring building. Lots of Venice has work going on the exterior of the buildings- so ask when you book or check-in. Staff was so kind though and their restaurant- La Caravelle- is expensive but wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Carnevale Junior Suite 86 with a terrace”
Reviews.Author: JChua
Reviews.Content: Touted as a 4 star Hotel and so it is - free Wifi, English TV channels, great location, spacious rooms and enough Receptionists to help out when you do have questions. Having travelled to Venice numerous times, and staying either on Riva degli Shiavoni for its great Lagoon views or hotels next to vaporetto stops, I had opted to stay one night here during Carnevale 2011 for great shopping - and it does serve its purpose. A few months before booking, I was emailed a number of junior suites to choose from - what a great service! However, I unwittingly chose the room 86, which was on the top floor with a medium sized terrace (with chairs and tables), overlooking the roof tops of Venice. The room is not large by any means but it does have a good size bathroom and terrace. However, this not-as-yet renovated room has sloppy beds (husband had a painful back after just one night!) and either too hard or too soft pillows, a problem which seems to be the norm in Italian hotels (so, no surprises here). The floor is wooden and is squeaky when one visits the loo in the night and you might disturb the other sleeping partner. Breakfast wise, surprisingly for a rather large hotel in Venice, is rather low in range as well as in quality. We had a simple breakfast and left Venice early for Florence via its nearest vaporetto stop, the Gilgio stop (near Hotel Ala and Gritti Palace). Overall, our stay was only average given the fact that I had personally chosen the wrong suite, so had no one else to blame ...But the Hotel does served its purpose for shopping and its common areas are indeed quite beautiful and very Venetian! However, do be very cautious of the nearby Ristorante Alla Borsa (out of the Saturnia, turn left and turn left again into a small alley, the very first restaurant that you would come across)! They charged us a whopping 71.50 euros for a two course dinner (one dish per person) with a 37.5cl of Cabernet. Service charge was 9.50 euros for 2 persons, no wonder only two tables were occupied on both of the Carnevale nights (peak Venetian season!) that we were there, do be aware! Try the second one on the same lane, Vinovino instead!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful carnaval stay”
Reviews.Author: venice11
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay at the hotel Saturnia and International. Minutes walk from Piazza San Marco (easy to find) a perfect location for tired legs after a hard days sight seeing. Oldey worldly charm and (best of all) "quiet" away from the hussle and bussle noise of visitors to this wonderful city on water.. The room was fabulous with hand painted ceiling and comfortable 4 poster bed (i could not fault it).. In the morning a lovely breakfast was just the thing to start the day. The staff were great from the moment we arrived (late and tired) till we departed 4 days later.. we highly recommend for a romantic break (getaway etc) and hope to return soon ourselves..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a superb location.”
Reviews.Author: Aitch11Cumbria
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. The location is minutes from St Mark's Square and from the Allilaguna and Vaporetto stops. The hotel itself is a very tastefully modified palazzo, our room retained its full height and original ceiling by having a double bed on a mezzanine with a superb marble bathroom, with separate bath and shower beneath, plus a sofa downstairs and 2 flat screen TVs, one on each level! Service from the staff at breakfast and the front desk is both friendly and unobtrusive. The breakfast provided a good choice and the evening meal we had in the restaurant was superb. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, hope to be returning”
Reviews.Author: adriana872
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel in an excellent location. It was easy to get to upon arrival (took the Alilaguna from the airport) and wonderfully central for all the major sights in San Marco and beyond. We arrived in the middle of afternoon, and were promptly shown to our room, which was on the first floor and easy to get to - they brought up our luggage for us. The moment we stepped in, we knew we made the right choice. The room seemed newly refurbished and was beautifully decorated, the bed had a headboard with a painted bucolic scene (very Italian!), there was a lovely Venetian glass chandelier (very Venetian!), and the bathroom had the best shower and bath tub I have seen in a hotel (and I travel a lot!). It wasn't a huge room but it offered plenty of space for what we needed and we loved returning to it after a day of wondering around Venice. The service was friendly and very helpful - I had a couple of special requests, such as tracking down a great grappa we tasted at one of the osterias and the concierge went above and beyond trying to locate it. Another concierge was equally helpful, with plentiful recommendations for places to eat that were based on his own experience and were obviously local haunts. We felt welcome and looked after. The only slight negative was a lack of decent internet connection - in order to connect one had to go to 1st floor to a specially designated area in a rather beautiful drawing room. The connection, when it happened, was very slow and couldn't handle my usual browsing habits. On the positive side, it is inexpensive at 3 euros for 3 hours. As I was on holidays, I wasn't too bothered but a wifi (or any internet connection) in the room would have made the hotel perfect for me. All in all, we liked hotel Saturnia (and Venice) so much that we plan to return regularly, and will always try to stay here, if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: MrsLT
Reviews.Content: Just had the most wonderufl stay at the Hotel Saturnia. The location is fantastic - on the best shopping street in Venice, a few minutes walk from St Marks Square one way and the Accademia Bridge the other. Our room was very nice - although looking at the pictures on the website was definitely not the best one! Breakfast very fresh and filling. We had complimentary tea in the bar in the afternoon - very restful (only in Jan I think though). Has a fabulous restaurant attached although we didn't eat there - this time. The concierge was so knowledgeable and helpful - a real asset to the Hotel. We can't wait to re-visit!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Yoyo1710
Reviews.Content: I booked our first trip to Venice as a surprise birthday treat for my husband & we stayed at the Hotel Saturnia. We were so impressed with the hotel - a beautiful, surprisingly large room, the service was personal yet professional and the restaurant La Caravella was outstanding. All attempts to speak Italian were gratefully received! It was the most wonderful experience and we shall never forget it. A big thank you to all the staff at this very special hotel and restaurant for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with wonderful service and very good location.”
Reviews.Author: skieroo8
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed very much our stay in the Saturnia Hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean. The atmosphere is great, and the location is superb. We shall come again in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “GREEEEEEAT”
Reviews.Author: veryfrenchie
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice service. Location is key and you won t be disappointed. Would recommend without any reservation.

Reviews.Title: “it was great”
Reviews.Author: Marigri22
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice for 2 days, choosed the Saturnia Hotel and were not disappointed. It is sharming, with venice's style, very big room with a lot of intresting things. Good breakfast, freindly staff. Yes, it was really great. The only one not so good - AC on the second floor (we had mesonetta) did not work good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Andy423
Reviews.Content: My wife and I selected Hotel Saturnia after a quick internet search. We had no information on the hotel other than their website and we chose the hotel based on the location and the price. We expected a typical small European room but upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised. The room was very large and had a separate closet, bathroom and shower. There was a huge tub in the bathroom and plenty of room everywhere. The staff was excellent and helped us with all requests. The location in Venice is very close to the major attractions and was within a few minutes walks of restaurants, museums, shopping and Saint Mark's Square. Overall we were pleasantly surprised with all aspects of this hotel. We will return to Hotel Saturnia in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best city break we've ever done”
Reviews.Author: kenitaranduter
Reviews.Content: Lovely, warm feel and look to the hotel and staff were just the same. Nothing was too much trouble. Obviously Andrea will soon be the next Italian Prime Minister! This will be a huge loss to Hotel Saturnia and the travel industry. We went for the gondola experience organised by the hotel. Okay, there's four gondolas, six passengers in each and only one serenader and accordianist between you, but it worked and we're glad we did it that way rather than just the two of us and a mute gondolier with an Ipod in his ear! We went to Burano and, on Andrea's recommendation, went for lunch at Trattoria Romano. We are so pleased that we did, it was a wonderful experience. We tried the soft shell crab - moeche in Venetian - which happened to be in season. It was delicious. Also had the risotto Romano - fabulous. La Caravella restaurant was a superb experience - try the fine noodles with shrimp and zuccini starter, it was exquisite. The sea bass main course was equally gorgeous. Staff gave us just the right amount of attention without being intrusive. General comments: travelling to Treviso airport is not a problem so don't let it put you off. Get the ATVO bus - they just wait outside for the incoming flights. You can get your tickets at the airport and the kiosk is really easy to see. Only 9 euros return to Piazzale Roma for the 65 minute journey. You can then pick up the vaporetto to go anywhere you want along the Grand Canal (and beyond) 24 hours a day. We got our 72 hour ticket at the ATVO kiosk at the airport - cost us 33 euros each which is well worth it. The same tickets got us out to the islands - Murano, Burano and Trocello. The weather was cold, wish we'd taken fleecy trousers, but it was sunny most of the time and there were no queues anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service and a spectacular room”
Reviews.Author: bdcsw1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Saturnia before but had not been there for a while. I was delighted to find that many of the staff at this family-owned hotel were the same and provided the same amazingly attentive service as in the past. The range of knowledge of the concierge is fabulous. I chose to upgrade to a suite and was given a very generous rate to do so. If I were to have one complaint (aside from everything now being non-smoking all over Venice) it would be that our room, #101, was so magnificent and the ceiling so spectacular that it was sometimes difficult to leave the room to take in all the splendor of Venice. Having a full breakfast was also wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: GeoffandRosemarie
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a five-day visit to the Saturniaâ€¦our 6th in 10 years. We would highly recommend the Saturnia to any visitor coming to Venice. Front desk staff is welcoming and professional, notably Andrea, the concierge. He can always be relied on to provide helpful suggestions for interesting places to visit, clear directions so we didnâ€™t get lost on the Vaporetto, and boots for aqua alta. The hotel was able to arrange special transportation to and from the airport making our arrival and departure very easy. Our room was wonderfulâ€¦spacious and comfortable overlooking a small canal. The location canâ€™t be beat with only a five minute walk to San Marco. The breakfast buffet with its wide variety is always a highlight. The hotelâ€™s restaurant La Caravella should not be missed. We return to the Saturnia because the Serandrei family and their staff treat us as their valued guests and welcome us like old friends. We look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “If we need a hotel in Venice again, this is where we'll stay”
Reviews.Author: LOGANCRAWFORD
Reviews.Content: A last minute booking to our favorite city almost by chane selected the Hotel Saturnia. The room was very comforatble and the bathroom fantastic. A very nice touch was the bottle of Prosecco for my wifes borthday. The staff had ppicked up this fact from her passport - very cute. A couple of minutes walk from St Marks, the Grand Canal and the Fenice Theatre. The location couldn't be better. Old fashioned professional service in the restaurant was a forgotten pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Saturnia Venice”
Reviews.Author: rnightingall
Reviews.Content: Lovely three day stay at this hotel. Despite floods nothing was too much trouble. Staff were quite charming and great sense of humour. Rooms were splendid, and excellent breakfast. Will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd stay at Hotel Saturnia in 10 years... as good as the 1st”
Reviews.Author: classof63
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Hotel Saturnia in the middle of September. The location of this hotel is excellent... within easy walking distance to everything. The hotel has a great restuarnt and bar. The breakfast is nicely done. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The hotel is a not inexpensiive, but nothing is inexpensive in Vencie.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: cavillous
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at this hotel and had a wonderful stay - the location couldn't be better. Our room was spacious and beautifully furnished in Deco style, with views over the terracotta rooftops of the city. All the staff were friendly and gave great service, it was obvious to see that they took great pride in their work. They even found us wellington boots to wear during the 'aqua alta'! It maybe a good idea to warn tourists that an alarm goes off 3 hours prior to expected 'aqua altas', as when we heard this at 5.30am in the morning we thought it was the fire alarm and got dressed ready to evacuate the hotel! We had dinner one evening in the restaurant which was excellent, with a good selection of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Tutto Bene!”
Reviews.Author: Chrissie77
Reviews.Content: I knew from the first email that this hotel was going to work for us. We stayed over last weekend for 3 nights. Arrived late friday and first impressions were good. We were taken to a lovely room, in fact 3 rooms leading into each other, everything we could have needed was there. We were in the art deco part of the hotel which I had requested if possible. Decor very tasteful and in keeping, comfort at every level! My pet hate in hotels is coat hangers which are attached and a nightmare to remove. Not here!! Large hangers for coats/jackets, thinner ones for other clothing. You see they have thought about everything. Even the tv was in a box which could be moved to view from the bed or seating area. We felt very "at home". Staff are extremely professional, and helpful. Breakfast was great, with a huge choice to suit all palates. We were awakened each morning by the sirens for flood alert. I pitied the poor people who had to get out of their warm beds to see that the walkways were in place where required. Quite a few places have flood gates but we did see shops having to sweep out the water, one of the downsides to Paradise. On Sunday was the Festa de Maria della Salute. The church was very near and we were able to walk across the canal on the temporary bridge erected for the occasion. The rain was heavy but it did not stop the thousands who came to pay their respects and light candles for a year of good health. A stunning church, full to bursting, listening to the Cardinal deliver his message. Great to be part of a local tradition. Location is near to St Marks Square, but very near a water bus if required. Venice is actually very small and you can easily walk to anywhere on the island. We enjoy "getting lost" and despite many visits still find new areas to explore. This is easily the best hotel we have stayed, in the many visits over 20 years. I would heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Concierge-Andrea Scarpa was incredibly helpful”
Reviews.Author: goldenchung6
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fabulous and the concierge, Andrea Scarpa, was especially helpful since my partner needed additional physical assistance. He couldn't be more fabulous and caring. Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay in venice!”
Reviews.Author: BettinaKaegi
Reviews.Content: Hotel saturnia made our stay in venice an unforgetable experience. The staff is very friendly and professional. Their very committed attitude exceeds the service of many 5 star hotels! Our dinners at the restaurant La Caravella were another fantastic experience. Excellent meals and perfect hosts! We highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: penguin248
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, by European standards. Nice bed linens, small shower (but, hey it is Europe! If you want an "amercian style" hotel, stay in America!). Bed was a little hard. And, no clock/alarm clock in the room was odd. Nice front desk staff (especially Andrew) and breakfast staff. Good breakfast included with room, including scrambled eggs and bacon. Would not recommend the restaurant that is attached to the hotel, unless you like stuffy staff and overpriced food. Additionally, one of the bartenders (not sure who), gave us $1 coins instead of $2 coins in our change, which we didn't realize until later. The food was fine, but better value can be found nearby (try Ristorante Alla borsa or VinoVino, both around the corner. Go down the first street (ally/sidwalk) to the left, as you are walking toward St. Mark's square. Follow the "Martini Bar" sign inlaid into the sidewalk.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our trip”
Reviews.Author: sailjerry
Reviews.Content: Hotel Saturnia is in a building that is a charming mix of early 20th century and 14th century. Our Room (101) was full of character, with antique furniture and a carved ceiling and at nearly 60m2 was very spacious. Not for those that want a sanitized characterless hotel experience. We got a good rate with Alpharooms website at Â£120 per room per night inc. breakfast The staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. Buffet breakfast, including bacon and scrambled eggs, sets you up for a day of sightseeing-the only problem being you may not have room for lunch. The location is very good for sightseeing. The restaurant and bar are expensive, but not for Venice. We went to Campo Santa Margherita and near S.Stefano church for better value and more lively evenings and there are hidden gems all over the city for eating and drinking.

Reviews.Title: “20th Anniversary, First trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Bellagio90
Reviews.Content: On our 20 year Anniversary, my wife and I had the privilege of visiting Venice. We had read many reviews of the Hotel Saturnia and we very happy we stayed at this hotel. The staff was so welcoming when we arrived. Our room was spacious, clean, and, decorated beautifully. The king size bed was comfortable.The shower in the bathroom was large and modern. We took the free hotel water taxi to the Murano Glass Factory, definitely worth your time. The free breakfast was a great way to start out your day in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: tapinfool2
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable stay. The breakfast buffet which was included was delicious. The staff at the desk was very helpful and able to answer all of our questions. We were able to convert our money to Euros at the desk. The room had beautiful glass fixtures. The only negative was a free ride to an island to see the Murano glass factory. We saw a short demonstration of glass blowing that then endured a "hard sell" in the showrooms. It wasn't the glass blowing demonstration we anticipated.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong on Saturnia”
Reviews.Author: MoiseinNC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Saurnia for 5 days and we loved it. The hotel is very well located close to St. Marc's Square and other interesting areas of Venice. In the front lobby, there is a framed letter from the late Ray Charles about his stay there. Great breakfast. Very helpful staff. We accidentally forgot a cell phone in our room and they graciously mailed it to our US address. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at historical hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Karin-Raffaella
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we experienced a warm welcome and a nice room making this a beautiful stay in Venice. As every year we enjoyed an excellent dinner in the hotel restaurant which we like because of its historic atmosphere, very good service and outstanding cousine. Even though we were there for business, the hotel staff offered several hints on what to visit and how best to reach. Alltogether the service we like - helpful and discrete.

Reviews.Title: “OLD CHARMING HOTEL, ON THE CANAL, NEAR ST. MARKS”
Reviews.Author: funlady
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an old one with warm, charming features. It is not inexpensive, but they give you a wonderful breakfast and the service is wonderful. They even arranged for us to get tickets to the La Fenice opera house. We had a room off a small canal adjacent to the Grand Canal. We could see the gondolas go by. When the tide is right, you can take a water taxi directly to the hotel. There was a pretty bridge near the hotel and we were right near La Fenice and close walking distance to St. Mark's Square. They sent a power boat for us and we went to the Murano Factory. The room was large and comfortable. We were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb”
Reviews.Author: Bunyip08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary.... what memories! We were delivered to the canal dock by water taxi..... and are large, spacious room complete with Murano glass chandelier was ready and waiting. The complimentary bottle of champagne for our anniversary was much appreciated on the wonderful rooftop deck, overlooking the roofs of Venice. Dinner at La Caravella restaurant was superb.. with wonderful food, fantastic service, fine wines and a great atmosphere! Breakfast were great and the location was so close to everywhere..... A truly wonderful hotel that will remain in our memories and hearts for a long time.....

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: mathilde_durvy
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in Venice and this hotel was just perfect. Beautiful rooms modern but charming at the same time. Excellent service and very friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location and Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: lgstrand
Reviews.Content: The location is what drew us to this spot. A short walk to St. Mark's Square and the names of the neighbors are Chanel, Gucci, Tod's, Ferragamo and all of the top names in fashion. But it is the outstanding concierge service and the endearing canal life below our room that will draw us back. Our 5 day stay was enriched each day by wonderful advice from Andrea at the front desk on places to see and dine. And the quiet rooftop terrace is a stunning retreat for a late afternoon glass of wine and a book. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with old world charm”
Reviews.Author: HRlady55
Reviews.Content: Our vacation this year was to travel to 3 different cities in Italy. Since I booked this on-line and never been to Italy before, I wasn't sure if the accommodations for two rooms in a 4 star hotel would live up to my standards. Needless to say, Hotel Saturnia Venice was the best hotel we stayed in during our trip. The hotel is in a good location, just a short "window shopping" walk from San Marco Plaza. It has a old world charm about it with very helpful concierges. The rooms were clean and reasonably size with a safe, minibar and flat LCD screen TV on the wall. The bathrooms were attractively done with a bidet, but the only negative I can say is that their blow dryers look like they're from the 80's and have no power. Their buffet breakfast was excellent with a lot of food to choose from, in fact, it was the best breakfast of all of the hotels we stayed at in Italy. Last, when we left Venice to go to the train station, the concierge arranged a water taxis to pick us up right in the back of the hotel so we didn't have to walk to any dock. Great hotel and we'll stay here again when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Cogesworde
Reviews.Content: Pleasant room with a small balcony which offered wonderful views across the rooftops. A perfect city centre location. Quiet but close to many key sites in Venice. Also near to a number of water bus stops which makes an ideal touring base. Our room looked down on the courtyard restaurant which, owing to the mild weather, was still open in early October. The noise generated was not excessive and finished before bed time. Very quiet at night, or at least until the bells started, but that's Venice. Staff were courteous and effecient. We will certainly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ALANBF
Reviews.Content: Arrived by water taxi from airport at hotel's private dock at about 10:30 AM. Desk staff warm and welcoming, and OUR ROOM WAS READY. Room very comfortable,Bathtub and separate shower, heated towel bar, safe in room, etc. Andrea, the concierge was helpful with restaurant recommendations, transportation arrangements and directions. We stayed 2 days before our cruise and returned for one day after. Warmly welcome by staff and we were given the same room. It's about 1/4 mile from St marks Square. Fabulous location. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “To have the ultimate stay in Venice that is quiet, romantic, perfect location, and great service-this is the place to be”
Reviews.Author: simbaToomsuba
Reviews.Content: We have never been to Venice before so this is a first impression experience. The Hotel Saturnia and International was delightful in every way!! The lobby and room keys spoke of history at its best, while the rooms and restaurant were modern in every way! The staff of the hotel and their restaurant, The La Caravella, was helpful at all times any when extremely busy:) The food and wine were exceptional. Our waiter even sat with us to give us our first taste of grappa and lemon cello!! It was so good we ate there twice in a 3 day stay! They have a generosity of spirit that we have not experienced in any stay in the USA. Not that I don't love my country, but this is true. They also have a way of distinguishing their lobby area. The hotel's owners produce an annual calendar which has a Venetian theme. Since their inception in 1981, they have a framed copy of each year in the lobby. A treat to look at and you will always remember this hotel's decor because of it. Another wonderful factor is the hotel's location. If you are into history, St. Mark's Square is a short stroll away crossing bridges with gondola's at your feet. If you are a shopper, Louis Vuitton, Prada, Channel..... are feet from the hotel entrance! Something for everyone!! In short Venice doesn't disappoint and neither does the Hotel Saturnia and International!!!!! We can't wait to return:) Jerry and Donna Pigford Toomsuba, MS USA

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ol1leo
Reviews.Content: Words can not describe pleasurable trip we had to Venice. From the quality of the hotel, the great front desk staff (Andre), the location of the hotel, and the fabulous restaurent

Reviews.Title: “Typically venician but miserable staff”
Reviews.Author: Mitain
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very near to St Markâ€™s square so in easy reach of everything â€“ thatâ€™s the plus however the hotel was pleasant enough to look at but the staff were all very miserable. The hotel was like a converted manor house with numerous antiques around the place, our actual room was not very large (however this is very common for Venice) and dark furnishings made it look even darker. It was quite higgledy piggledy in its layout but had several nice quirky features. On the first floor it opened into a lounge seated area with lots of heavy venetian furnishings including a well tuned piano which no-one ever seemed to play â€“ except for me and I got scowled at ! The highlight for us was a wonderful roof terrace which after a long day of sightseeing you could sit and enjoy the evening sun. The food at breakfast was ok , the hotel is joined to the restaurant next door and a good selection of meats and cheese with hot bacon and scrambled egg were available as well as the usual cereals and toast but the big bonus was we sat and ate it outdoors. However the waiters were so so miserable and the service was dreadful As for food in the evening â€“ there are much better and more reasonably priced places to eat. Again I found the restaurant staff very miserable and quite snooty e.g. there was a notice on the menu that said they could offer trousers and a jacket for men to wear whilst dining....we choose to only eat there for one night. All in all the hotel was expensive and I felt somewhat pretentious, had the staff been more amenable it would have been a much more pleasant experience

Reviews.Title: “My Mom & I thoroughly enjoyed the ambiance, convenience, service, staff, location & breakfast at Hotel Saturnia.”
Reviews.Author: Hollyfs
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location! I do not have 1 complaint about Hotel Saturnia. The English speaking staff went above & beyond to make our stay comfortable. The breakfast was abundant, clean room, spacious bathroom & gorgeous view from roof top terrace. The hotel is a very short walk to Piazza San Marco. Shopping & an ATM are also nearby! I would gladly return to Hotel Saturnia.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kpatton19
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Saturnia is in a great location. The staff is warm, friendly, charming and extremely helpful. We will stay there on our next visit to the wonderful city of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “110% effort to make my stay a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTom_55
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Saturnia staff is one of the most professional, knowledgeable and friendly that I have experienced in many years of business travel throughout Europe. Multiple stays consistently resulted in a wonderful experience. The Hotel architecture, the rooms, the staff and the morning breakfast are second to none.

Reviews.Title: “very central”
Reviews.Author: sibiaa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central to Venice, just a short walking distance from St Marks Sq and all the various water taxis, which too could be reached in about 10 minutes walk. The reception staff are not the politest people, as they hardly ever look up to greet the passing guests. They could be sent to school to learn the basic simple greetings or smile for guests. The concierge/s are very helpful, especially Eduardo, who apart from speaking in different languages, also has very pleasant manners about him and a lot of patience to explain things in detail to the guests. When asking for a late check out of another 3 hours, would not accomodate, even though the hotel seemed not busy at all. The rooms we had were on the top floor at the back, which were okish for our short stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Isolde28465
Reviews.Content: I just returned from two weeks in Italy and I have to say, Venice (and the Hotel Saturnia) were the highlight of the trip. The staff was fabulous, particularly Evan and Andrea. I think all the women who stayed at the hotel wanted to bring Evan home with them, but his heart belongs to his beautiful little boy and his wife. Thank you one and all for making this leg of the journey so very special!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable choice, very well located, with mediochre standards but a lot of space”
Reviews.Author: SCAN60
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely well located only a few minutes' walk from the Piazza St. Marco in Venice. The hotel is evidently very old and, I believe, family run. The decor in my extremely spacious room, which has a 6ft (1800mm) bed, is in good order and the room appears clean. Furnishings appear old but are in reasonable order. The bed is very comfortable. The rooms are air-conditioned and the noise from the equipment, whilst not silent, is reasonably unobtrusive. Generally, room soundproofing appears only adequate; unlike more modern properties, the main door opens immediately into the main part of the room and consequently the bed is close to it. There is therefore the risk (mercifully not realised on my visit) of corridor noise from the lift and stairs which are just outside. There was, however, during the daytime, some quite intrusive banging and shuffling penetrating from elsewhere. And, being on the top floor, my room was close to the air-conditioning equipment outside which produced an incessant cycling low hum which was just audible enough to be an irritation. There is a mini-bar which is typically over-priced. The hotel has a wireless Internet offering plus some desktop machines in a public area for guests' use. The service is chargeable, although at EUR2.00 for 3 hours non-contiguous use I don't consider it expensive. The connection was, however highly variable (this was a technical problem, not a WiFi signal reception issue) and I had to re-start my connection many times; one might expect better from a service that bears even a nominal charge. There is a wide flat-screen TV with many channels, a few of which are in other languages. The en-suite bathroom is of adequate size and is fitted with old ceramics and plumbing - I guess from the style and colour, from the 1970's. The shower head (over the bath) barely produces a dribble. There are cracks in the tiling and sealant, and less obvious surfaces (like the window frame and hairdryer base unit) haven't seen a duster for months, possibly years. It's overdue for a substantial refit. Toiletries are a basic offering; everything is there, but, for example, the liquids are in sachets rather than bottles and the soap bars are tiny. There are plenty of towels. The breakfast buffet is mainly continental style with various bread and pastries, cold fruit, meat and cheese, and yoghurt etc. There is also well prepared scrambled egg, and bacon, neither of which are kept properly warm. The juices are good and the bread is reasonably fresh. On warm mornings, breakfast is served outside. Customer service didn't seem to be in any way exceptional. Greetings were perfunctory. Our tour group (24 people) had an early deparure (by train) scheduled for our last morning, yet, despite the size of the group, there was no question of an earlier than standard (7 am) start to breakfast, which meant a rushed sitting and no opportunity to return to the room afterwards. It tends to suggest that their customers are not a priority in their thinking. Disappointing. What is very unusual for a hotel in the centre of such a very compact city, is the size of the interior. The room is a very good size, but the public spaces, of which there are several spread over the various floors, are huge, each with various antique (style) furnishings and so on. There is also a roof garden with sun loungers for those who wish to relax just away from the noise of the crowds below. The lift is another matter; barely big enough for three. My summary rating reflects the fact that Venice, as a city, has a lot of physical constraints on it; it is a very tourist-centric city and is generally more expensive than many; my guess is that many Venetian hotels are either much smaller or suffer the negatives of this place to a similar degree, or both. For this reason I have perhaps been a little charitable. Perfect location, good sized rooms, but perhaps in need of some work, and could certainly stand some customer service improvement. Nevertheless, a reasonable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks about your kindness”
Reviews.Author: hotoku_1907
Reviews.Content: Dear : Manager, I stayed your hotel from Aug.9th to Aug.12th. I really appreciate your kindness. I felt that there is a beautiful city in Venezia The building of your hotel had a calm atmosphere. We enjoyed spending a lot during 4 days. Especially, staying your hotel is our most wonderful memory in Venezia The Staff were very polite ,cheerfulness, and sometimes full of humor with hospitalityâ€¦ We really had a great time in your hotel. Thank you very much again. We are looking forward seeing you again Sincerely, Akira Kubota 3-13-5ã€€Takajou Aoiku Shizuoka-city Shizuoka-pref. Japan P.S. I donâ€™t have much confidence in English. So I hope that my message makes sense to you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Gamero1985
Reviews.Content: Our stay has been such an amazing experience. It is a lovely place to spend your holidays and the staff is simply great. Thanks for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a Castle”
Reviews.Author: rg66
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We were recommended by family members to stay here. We thought the hotel would be on the small side, but it was very large inside. Our kids felt like we were in a castle. Our room for three was very large. The common space on our first floor was huge. The staff were very helpful and always happy. When it rained they provided us with umbrellas. It was on the more expensive side, but worth it. Breakfast was very nice in the garden. The location can't be beat, walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: RodMac
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Saturnia & International for 4 nights. Hotels in Venice (and everything else, for that matter) are expensive. We got a very good rate for only about 20 euros more per night than 2-3 star hotels were offering because it was nonrefundable. I was very relieved when the hotel graciously changed our dates at no charge when our trip was delayed. The staff were helpful, the hotel was easy to find from the San Marco Vaporetti. The room was exceptional. Living room area and very large bathroom (huge tub, seperate marbled shower, two seperate sinks and toilet and bidet) were on main level with a loft where the twin beds were located. The buffet breakfast was lavish by European standards, with eggs, bacon, fresh fruit, cereals, juices, coffee and breads, croissants and breakfast pastries, yoghurt. A breakfast of this caliber would cost easily 20 euros in Venice. Very clean, abundant and luxurious towels and linens and exceptionally good maid service were offered. I found this hotel to be exceptionally good value, although all I am usually looking for is a private bath and cleanliness in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For anyone who wants "something extra".”
Reviews.Author: Hallo189541
Reviews.Content: I will gladly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants "something extra". Eventhough hotel Saturnia is a large and rather expensive hotel it has a kind of nice personal atmosphere. The reception staff are efficient but very warm and welcomming. Both the breakfast but specially a stylish dinner in Saturnias openair "garden-restaurant" proves that this is a real luxury hotel. Not to mention that on this hotel the aircon is actually working:-) MBNielsen, Denmark

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: smb157
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent one night in Venice and enjoyed our stay at the Saturnia very much. The hotel is located in the heart of Venice- a few hundred yards from Saint Mark's square. Our rooms looked out over a canal and we could watch the gondola's floating past. Yet, the rooms are very quiet. The staff was knowledgeable and very accommodating. They went out of their way to help us fix a car rental problem- and provided directions/advice about various attractions. The front desk also arranged a great gondola ride for our party of 9 complete with a serenade. The price was much lower than what the gondoliers were charging along the grand canal. By booking through the hotel we paid just 40 euros per person. Breakfast- included in the rate- was terrific! And you eat outside in a beautiful garden. We'd love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Saturnia”
Reviews.Author: ChristianeDubai
Reviews.Content: From the moment we found the Hotel Saturnia (two bridges and a magical walk down a few lanes away from San Marco we entered the wonderfully quaint front lobby that upon closer inspection is rooted in history. The staff were extremely helpful from the start to finish (we had lost our luggage - they helped in finding it, we needed train times to Lake Garda- they furnished them) and were generous in their informaiton of Venice and its environs. The breakfast was the best we had in our fortnight in Italy...delicious and served with much humour (much appreciated first thing in the morning.) I highly recommend this hotel for its spacious rooms, cleanliness, ambience and extrememly central location in Venice....I shall be returning...if only to be greeted in the warm fashion the front desk and helpful Monsieur de Concierge treated us each time we walked through the door....

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel for Seeing Venice!”
Reviews.Author: LongDec08
Reviews.Content: I'm an American living in Italy so I travel Europe frequently. Hotels here are much different than what you will typically find in the United States. When it comes to what I would consider a "tourist class" hotel; Hotel Saturnia is awesome. The rooms are a reasonable size and the bathrooms modern. The hotel staff were very pleasant and spoke excellent English. The location is fantastic. It's just a few minutes to San Marc's and the water busses. My one disappointment with the hotel was their restaurant. Venice is expensive to begin with but the restaurant was even beyond that. It was more of a gourmet place and not really suited for families. Fortunately there are many options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “exellent business trip”
Reviews.Author: nizubai7
Reviews.Content: Exellent experience in conference room.good restaurant.silent atmosphere.Good parking facilities.Free internet faculty.i suggest this hotel to my company more.

Reviews.Title: “4 days in Venice”
Reviews.Author: fred2006
Reviews.Content: The Hotel have a spirit the employee are always available for you, they advise you on what to do or not do. The Room was amizing request the room number 106. The restaurant located in this hotel is a little bit expensive but the food quality is exceptional and the service excelent. Located at 3 minutes form the San Marco plazza

Reviews.Title: “A great find overall and especially for solo travelers”
Reviews.Author: SaraZ23
Reviews.Content: What a gem. I found this hotel to have the comforts of a nice hotel (wonderful service, exceptionally clean rooms, beautiful bathrooms, a great bed (!), in great condition, etc.) with a stunning decor that really makes you feel like you're staying somewhere special. Not tacky special -- it's sophisticated but true to local culture. After a week of Italian-style breakfasts (wonderful but small and sweet) and a bit of a hangover, I admit I was thrilled to discover buffet (included) had fruit, yogurt, breads, pastries, ham and eggs. Amen. Don't miss the really lovely rooftop. I traveled by myself and chose this hotel because of its central (but still quiet at night), well-lit location and the fact they staff the desk throughout the night -- I had read reviews telling of other hotels' locked doors and difficulty getting in after midnight. If I go back to Venice, I would stay here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Bastion of Extreme Hospitability”
Reviews.Author: ProyousArt
Reviews.Content: We were very limited time-wise; staying only a short two days in Venice. We entered the reception area to check into our rooms. We did not have a clear plan of what we were going to do, but the manager who oversaw our check-in process(without any prompting or asking) completely planned our trip for us. He suggested a free of charge water taxi tour to the Murano Glass Factory where we were given a tour in which they showed us the complete process of glass making/blowing. He also told us all about the Feast of the Redeemer which happens once a year. After a detailed explanation about the event, he gave us two options that the hotel could provide to see the spectacular hour-long fireworks. All in all, as far as the service is concerned, the Saturnia staff have been incredibly helpful and friendly. The rooms are generally clean and sufficiently spacious. The area outside our rooms is very creaky and in the middle of the night, people would be walking around and it would be quite noisy. Anyway I don't want to rant but here's a summary: + Friendly Staff + Free of charge complimentary tour to the Murano glass factory + Clean rooms - Creaky floorboards outside - More creaky floorboards - Revenge of the creaky floorboards

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Saturnia gets our first place vote!”
Reviews.Author: waveformsys
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel door by water taxi a day early for our reservation. The very capable staff assisted us with our 2 rooms to accommodate 5 people (3 boys in 1 room and my wife & I in the other). Throughout our stay everyone at the hotel was fantastic. The rooms were perfect and the hotel is ideally located about a 2 minute walk from St. Marks Square. The breakfast had a great selection and the garden setting was prefect. My only regret: Hotel Saturnia provides large, heavy silver keys crafted as artworkâ€”how could my 23 year old son forgotten to turn it in before leaving the hotel. We delivered it at the airport to the Information Desk, but the key has not been located. We are sorry for our oversight and hope you will accept us again on our next visit to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service and best location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MrGToronto
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can not be beat. It is walking distance to St. Mark ' s on a street with shops for browsing, but not overcrowded like Some of the hotels right near St. Mark 's. The concierge and staff was superb - they Gave excellent recommendations for restaurants and were extremely friendly . The hotel building Itself is an old palace and is authentically Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and excellent restaurant”
Reviews.Author: EarthLover19
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location. The restaurant was great, bit expensive but every cent is worth spending given the pleasure we get on enjoying the food.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious family-sized room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelswithkidsNY
Reviews.Content: We reserved this hotel very last-minute (the day before!) for our family, two adults & 2 kids ages 6 & 9. We were so pleasantly surprised to find a family-sized room with two extra beds and plenty of space to move around, separate closet, desk & table. The staff was very friendly, flexible when we wanted to add on another night (also last-minute) & helpful, giving us several excellent recommendations of restaurants & things to do. The breakfast is excellent and the outdoor garden where they serve it is a lovely way to start the day. The location is very convenient (if a little touristy) because it is near the St.Marks vaparetto station where all the boats stop.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Friendly”
Reviews.Author: dflan22
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel in the "heart" of the city. Quick walk to San Marco. Well appointed, very comfortable,large, quiet rooms. Excellent "american" breakfast every day. Front desk personnel were very helpful. Would recommend this hotel without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Service was the BEST.”
Reviews.Author: tarponpipe
Reviews.Content: We stayed only two nights but the experience was a good as anything that we have had for a historic old hotel. The desk service was unbeatable as they answered all questions about Venice, made recommendations, made reservations handled some things we left behind being sure they made it home quickly and safely. The location is in the heart of everything in Venice. 2-3 minute walk the main San Marco piazza.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience for our whole family!”
Reviews.Author: Diane005
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in October 2009 for three days pre-cruise, Upon returning home we arranged to take our whole family for a cruise in June and immediately booked 4 rooms at the Saturnia for our group of 12. We knew our children and grandchildren would enjoy this hotel and they did. The front desk staff is the friendliest (very good with the 4 children in our group) and most helpful I have found in all of Italy. The hotel is very conveniently located to everything we wanted to see and do and the water entrance was great. The breakfast patio is just beautiful and the hotel has the most amazing antiques throughout. All in all, a thoroughly delightful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, high quality staff, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: pandrade28
Reviews.Content: Excelent stay. We arrive from airport with Allillaguna red line at St Marcos, 5 minutes walking to the hotel, very easy to arrive . Staff very kind and professional. Nice room. Good breakfast. With ACTV boats we can go everywhere and visit everything in 3 days. Go to Murano if you want to see the glass factories. Important to see Lido. Very nice. Go to the beach (five minutes walking from the boat).

Reviews.Title: “strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: aencalada
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to visit Venice for vacation and stayed in the Hotel Saturnia. The experience overall was excellent, it surpassed my expectations. The service provided by the hotel satff was incredible. The hotel is also very well located near Piazza San Marco, and close to very to very nice shops. But one of the best things of the hotel is its restaurant, I still cannot forget the dinner I had there, and look forward to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “We had an amazing stay at this beautiful hotel in Venice and would recommend it to any traveller.”
Reviews.Author: ejcap
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at this historic, beautiful hotel in the heart of Venice. We traveled with our 4 adult children, ages 18-26 and we all had a wonderful time. The hotel staff were so helpful, especially Andrea. The restaurant served delicious food in an elegant atmosphere. Our rooms were lovely. The location was perfect. We would love to visit again and have already recommended it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DominicCambridge
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlfriend in June 2010 after booking on their website. Price is very good compared with similar 4 star hotels in San Marco district. The hotel is about a 2 minute walk to San Marco square, so a fantastic location. We were upgraded on arrival into a lovely room, which overlooked a small canal. The room was very clean, and was a good size. Breakfast, which was included, was simple, but yet very good, and you wouldn't really want anymore. The main highlight was probably the roof terrace. We had amazing weather, and spent the evenings sat on the terrace with a bottle of presecco. It has several chairs/deckchairs and loungers, and great views over the city. The staff on reception were very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The hotel also offered a free trip to Murano including transport, which was very good and great to go as we probably wouldn't have gone otherwise. All in all, I would highly recommend the the hotel, and would definitely tell friends and family to stay, and would stay again if I go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room, and service. Excellent value too!”
Reviews.Author: MaineacFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Saturnia for 2 nights with our 2 children ages 8 and 11. I would definitely stay here again. We had a very quiet large room with one large bed and two single beds. Internet service worked well on the first 2 - 3 floors and was inexpensive (2 Euros for 10 hours). Andrea, the concierge, was most helpful in recommending activities. The location, 5 minutes walk to St. Mark's Square, is also very convenient. Although we had no view of the canals, the price was very reasonable compared with those hotels with such views. The breakfast buffet was wonderful too - a large selection that even finnicky American children liked.

Reviews.Title: “Delighful”
Reviews.Author: Sggranados
Reviews.Content: We had a wondeful stay at this hotel. The personnel is courteus and helpful. The location close to San Marco and other sites is extremely convenient for the independent traveler who likes to explore by himself. The multilingual concierges are very helpful in planing your visits and making reservations. They compare favorably with concierges in 5 star hotels in large cities like Tokio, Paris or Munich. Venice is not an unexpensive city to visit but here you definitely get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent hotel restaurant”
Reviews.Author: AndreaBH
Reviews.Content: This hotel was was in a fabulous location just a short walk to Saint Mark's square. Everything in Venice is walking distance but the location of this hotel was central and easily accessible via vaporetto (water taxi). The room was extremely spacious and clean. The hotel is a bit old but well maintained. There was a regular shower with lots of hot water. The towels were thick. It was very quiet at night, slept very well! The buffet breakfast was good. They provided free boat service to the island of Murano so we avoided paying the fare to take a vaporetto. It was a bit expensive (297 Euros per night), but in Venice everything is expensive! We had dinner at the hotel restaurant (La Caravella) one night, which was fabulous. A bit pricey, but is a nicer restaurant (many men were in jackets).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Saturina”
Reviews.Author: ShanH
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I had a wonderful time at the Saturnia. We were in Venice in September for the Biennale. The staff were warm and friendly and assisted us most days with our itinerary while in Venice. Our room was beautifully outfitted with Italian brocade fabric covered walls, murano fixtures and beautiful wooden side tables and large console and closets. It was and a good size for a European standard room, with a very large bathroom and tub. The building maintained an old world feel with its finishings throughout the plazzo, and it's rooftop terrace is a wonderful place to watch the sun set in the evenings. The restaurant downstairs serves up an amazing buffet for breakfast including Italian staples- cold cuts, coffees and pastries along with the typical breakfast fare of cereals, eggs and cheeses. The location is perfect! It is only a few steps from St Mark's square, and a short walk from the grand canal and the Rialto. This hotel is a must-stay when visiting Venice. We travel often and will be back to the Hotel Saturnia.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: SMW_10
Reviews.Content: A charming , friendly and well appointed hotel , right in the heart of the San Marco area. Approx a 2 minute stroll to Piazza San Marco and its sights and the Grand Canal. Short stroll to La Feniche, and the Rialto Bridge. Four Star, family run, with friendly , warm and efficient staff, always willing to assist. Suites and rooms well appointed ( have stayed in both) and great buffet breakfast! In-house restaurant is worthy of its reputation. Last stayed in Jan 2010 with teenage daughters and younger son and hotel welcoming to all. Hotel happy to organise any transfers and day trips you require and advise you re local sights and restaurants. This is the 3rd time I have stayed here and each time has been fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and great location”
Reviews.Author: fridavh
Reviews.Content: Its a beautiful hotel, you should go up and down to visit it all! It has a great location, walking distance to San Marcos and near to one of the VaporettoÂ´s stop. (its better if you travell by vaporetto instead of a water taxi, ist cheaper). The staff is great! You will love the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: AH0005
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for 2 nights (March 28 & 29) and it has exceeded our expectations. Wonderful location and good size room and bathroom. The hotel restaurant is also excellent. But the one thing that stands out is the Concierge (don't know his name, but he is tall, young and works the mornings and early afternoons). Of all our travels, he IS THE BEST CONCIERGE that we have encountered. Upon check-in, he circled all the highlights for us on the map. Given our short stay, he recommended a private tour guide for our family. It was the best walking tour we ever had. It was 2 hours and we learned about the history and etc. about Venice. The tour guide spoke perfect English. The hotel did not get a cut of the tour because we paid the guide directly. We also took a gondola ride and instead of giving us directions to the pier, the Concierge walked us over himself. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ask the concierge”
Reviews.Author: DDS-Kioi
Reviews.Content: Great centrally located hotel, the kind of place one would expect in Venice. I booked just days ahead of the trip and had a big room with a view. The best part was the advice I received from the concierge. I explained the kinds of things I was interested to see, and he mapped out an itinerary for me each day. I went to parts of the city that are not only the usual tourist hangouts (such don't-miss places are popular for a reason) but also to areas that brought the full character of the real Venice to light. I would have been lost without this excellent advice, and it made all the difference for a wonderful weekend. Not to overstate the case, but every place he recommended met or exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Exceelent Location Ang Great Staff Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gonso98
Reviews.Content: Dear All, I just want to recommend to all of you planning to go to venice soon to stay in above hotel, located right on the spot of the city, where the shops are, restaurants and St Mark Sq, location is perfect, also try the hotel restaurant LA CARAVELLA excellent food ...., hotel rooms are very big and clean and the buffet breakfast is nice ....waiters spoke more than 5 laguajes and were very polite...as conclusion, great hotel great place great loction higly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but service was poor”
Reviews.Author: BillandLori
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights with superior double (nice) and single (paper thin walls with lots of hammering). Staff was not friendly at all and tried to charge us for two extra rooms.
