It took three tries to straighten out. Everyone was very formal and somewhat stuffy. On the plus side the hotel is near San Marco square and high end shopping area. The rooms were clean and the breakfast service was the best we had on our trip. Overall, this hotel was not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location and top notch service.”
Reviews.Author: sbesko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 3 different hotels during this trip to Italy - Rome, Florence and Venice. All were 4 star hotels however the Saturnia in Venice was the best by far of all three hotels despite all having the same star rating. Excellent service, rooms are very clean and well maintained, breakfast is excellent and the location is just a 5 min walk from San Marco. We were extremely pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the few real great deals in expensice Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Alban
Reviews.Content: I strongly recomment this hotel. I spent three nights there and I have nothing negative to say. We had a great deal (c.Â£110 per night) and it was really worth it. The room was relatively spacious, very clen and recently refurbished with style. Staff was charming and helpful. Even the breakfast was good, which is extremely rare in Italy. For the location, you can't beat it (sharp in the centre and close without being too close to San Marco piazza.

Reviews.Title: “A 5* hotel at 4* prices”
Reviews.Author: mtwsew
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice for Carnivale and chose the Saturnia due to its proximity to San Marco. Not only is it very well located (and easy to find-a real plus in Venice) but it was charming and the rooms were beautifully furnished. It was my birthday and the conceirge sent up a bottle of Prosecco which I thought was very thoughful. We've been in Venice a number of times and stayed at the Gritti, and the Danieli and felt that the Saturnia was very close to equaling those properties. (I had checked into staying at the Gritti for this trip, but it was $200/night more) The Saturnia is a real find in Venice. It also included a hot and cold buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, great loaction, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ordhgk
Reviews.Content: Our family had a last-minute opportunity to travel to Venice. The hotel staff was very responsive to a series of e-mails regarding the accommodations and we were fortunate to obtain a room directly on a back canal at a very reasonable price. The hotel is very conveniently located between San Marcos and the Academia Bridge in the high-end shopping district. The baroque-period hotel has beautiful rugs, chandeliers and furniture and is wonderfully maintained. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dcristut
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very well located close to St.Marco Square. Huge and clean room + nice and helpful staff both to the Reception desk and Restaurant. Faces the same problem as all Venice Hotels: Very difficult to find onto the narrow streets and canals (especially in late evening and rain :( like my case), I think we wandered for more than 2 km around St.Marco sq. for a 200-300 meters distance like it really was, even if that was not our first visit in Venice and we were somehow aware of the surroundings. I will gladly be back both in Venice and Saturnia Hotel I would however like to have EASY INTERNET ACCESS ! Now it is based on some sort of payable coupons !? very unsuitable for hotel's rank. Florin-Daniel Cristut Roumania

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with distinctive charm and character with hospitality to match”
Reviews.Author: Kenyawallah
Reviews.Content: We returned to this hotel 15 years after having spent our honeymoon there, and found Hotel Saturnia & International to have the same distinctive charm and high standard of amenities and service. Returning now with our two children (aged 13 years and 9 years) we were given a spacious family suite at no extra cost, with fresh flowers daily. The suite was elegantly furnished, with modern en-suite facilities, and cleaned daily. All hotel staff were courteous and very helpful, especially the concierge and booking staff. The bar area was elegant and well stocked. The hotel also offers a very large hall with a real historic feel and period furnishing - several visitors used it in the evening, as we did but always with privacy available to each group. We were able to meet and chat with some of the hotel guests there over drinks. There is also a roof-top terrace, which does require the summer to enjoy (as we did on our previous visit). The breakfast is hearty, provided with excellent service, and sets one up for the day. The location of the hotel is superb, it is a real bonus as it is only a few minutes walk to the grand San Marco square. Visiting in November, we had the good fortune to have very good weather, including two sunny days. On our last day, the high tide flooded the square and actually came into the hotel foyer at a very low level. The hotel staff were very well prepared, and this was dealt with as a matter of routine (as do all the shopkeepers near the square), and did not cause any discomfort to guests. The hotel staff were kind enough to loan us Wellington's to walk around in, and the square and the palace looked like they stood in the lagoon - this was a truly memorable sight, with gondolas seemingly travelling right up the ancient buildings. Our younger child in particular was in his element, and waddled in the water ecstatically. As the tide subsided within 2-3 hours, alas it was also our time to leave Venice. It had proved to be a wonderful trip, helped enormously by staying at this hotel again. We are looking forward to returning. Venice remains a truly magical place.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Magjias
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Saturnia & International for 2 nights at the end of October 2009. I attended a conference in Venice and Hotel Saturnia was a good choice. I arrived in the evening by a water taxi from the airport (very very expensive :105 euros) but, passing through the canals and the old bridges and arriving at the back door of the hotel, I felt like a VIP person, or better I felt like living in an ancient time! Venice is one of the best places in the world, even if a little bit melancholic. My room at the hotel was very nice, maybe a little bit too old-fashioned for my taste. The bad was very large and comfortable; the tv set unfortunately didnâ€™t work very well, the minibar was very â€œminiâ€� and there was no tea or coffee one can makes in the room. The bathroom was nice and well-equipped. The shower was so beautiful! I had a good breakfast in the morning where I could taste some of the typical Venetian cakes and sweets, in addition to cornflakes, croissant, bread and jam ..I mean there was everything one expects to have for breakfast. The staff is kind and friendly. I used internet twice but the PC was old and there was no office programs but the connection was fast. Last but not least the location is perfect! 2 minutes walking by Piazza San Marco, the heart of this marvelous city!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is wonderfol”
Reviews.Author: coffeFlorida
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel a few days .. i had a good receive .. when i arrived l at the reception door the goalkeeper explained me how to go to Rome and offered me a good cup of hot tea .. The staff was very kindly and always smiling .. the ROOMS are CLEAN AND COMFORTABLE, EVERY DAY they ALWAYS keep CLEAN CLOTHES ..in the MORNING i alwaly have good BREAKFAST . Rome is fantastic .. THIS HOTEL IS EASY to reach is located a few steps from the train ..

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: SparkyEMids
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in the heart of the city. Large rooms and bathrooms (by Italian standards). Not an identikit hotel chain but an historical building with beams, antique furniture and real character. Yes, the floors creek but what do you expect of an old building. Breakfast was very good (agian by Italian standards) and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The front desk were very helpful in planning trips and getting around. Even the teenagers were impressed! Internet â‚¬2 / 3hrs in room. In the very centre of everything, only minutes from St Mark's Square and all the fashion shops right outside. Note: location, easy when you know - from St Mark's Square, with your back to the Bascillica, take the LH arch and walk straight ahead. Over the small canal bridge. 50m on the right.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: megan_ns
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Saturnia for 3 nights and hated every minute of it. We checked in about midnight and were not greeted very nicely by the night front desk receptionist. He demanded our passports and was rude about wanting to keep them instead of letting me wait until he was finished getting the info he needed. We were given room 25 and forced to cram into the tiny elevator with both our large suitcases and the large bellhop. My first thought when we entered the room was that I must have been looking at the wrong hotel on tripadvisor because all the reviews and pictures were good and this didn't compare. The bed was two twins pushed together and you could feel the wooden frame in the middle. It was also super hard and thin with the worst pillows my husband had ever slept on. The ceiling was the best feature, being extremely high and with wooden beams across it. Our window faced the front street which was loud with people at night and construction pounding and drilling beginning in the morning and continuing throughout the day. The noise was also loud within the room, coming from the hall when people walked by and all the rooms around us. I could hear each time a light switch was switched in our neighbor's room. You could hear people talking through the vent in the bathroom, too. Needless to say, we didn't get much sleep during our whole stay. The bathroom was ok sized but needs to be updated. The shower had black mold growing between the tiles and it was the size of a small closet. You hit your elbow on the water temperature handle every time your brought your arm down. The temperature was also inconsistant, ranging from scalding hot to freezing cold. There was a hairdryer machine attached to the wall which I think had been there for 20 years. It took double the time to dry my hair and the handle got burning hot but the air was cool coming out. Breakfast is included with the booking of the room. It was an ok spread but nothing was kept on ice. The meats and cheeses were kept out on platters, which if you got there later, meant the cheese was slightly melted. Didn't want to drink the milk or eat the yogurt since it had been sitting out all morning without being kept on ice. There was a good selection of pastries. The best feature of the hotel is its location. We had slight trouble following the directions to get there but once found, everything else is a short distance away. The only reason I would book this hotel is for the location. Overall, due to the ridiculous price, I expected a much nicer experience. I would never stay here again or recommend this hotel. But if you do book, never stay in room 25.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Venetian experience”
Reviews.Author: bellasally
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Venice where I spent 7 days. I stayed at hotel Saturnia and I think I will saty there again when my next travel takes me to Venice. The hotel used to be a venetian house "Ca Pisano". The location can't be better withing a short walk from the vaporetto stop S. Marco Vallaresso. The decor reflects typical 18th century venetian docor. But best of all is the staff who was very helpful, cheerful and very friendly. Breakfast is served in a beautiful dinning room with a good variety of food. I certainly highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: kalena98
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Saturnia in Venice. The breakfast buffett,which was included, was excellent! our rm overlooked the street and shops at the front of the hotel. The rm. was roomy and quiet. The staff was very helpful for all of our questons and gave us excellent directions!The location was the best thing....close to everything we did.We went to the Opera one night..and the walk to the Opera House was about 5 min.!! and very picturisque!! We can't wait to visit Venice again & would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, you want to stay here”
Reviews.Author: bachryst1
Reviews.Content: I have been in the travel industry for 40 years. I loved the hotel, Location: It is well situated to get around Venice, with a three minute walk to St Mark's Square. It is one one of the fashionable streets in Venice. Staff: The hotel staff was great, with them helping me with unusual requests. The service in the restaurant was excellent and the food was superior. Hotel It is made of 4 palaces joined together, with amazing original antiques. They are all around a central courtyard which offers a full American breakfast each morning. Each room has it's own beautiful antiques. The hotel should give tours of the hotel as it is full of fabulous history. It is family run and they are on site all the time, making sure the customer is satisfied. You can't go wrong with staying here - great location, rooms, service and food. What more could you want and it's all in beautiful Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special for the price”
Reviews.Author: Hasson
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel itself is beautiful and special, the staff were slightly pretentious and didn't make my girlfriend and I feel to welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Our best stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: mapiSaoneetLoire
Reviews.Content: The Saturnia hotel is very well located : when we arrive by vaporetto it is easy to find and it is also well located in order to go to monuments and sight seeing. The room was for 4 persons (2 adults and 2 teenagers) : it was very large and very nice. Also the bathroom was very large. Although we were on the 1st floor, we didn't hear enything. The breakfast was good too. We spent time in the evening on the terrace which is on the roof. So we had a very good time. The staff was very pleasant and spoke several langages. The best thing we liked was the situation of the hotel and its amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & clean”
Reviews.Author: bptx
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 2 night stay at the Hotel Saturnia. The hotel is well located but not located in a high traffic area. The breakfast buffet was very good with something for everyone. Don't miss the view from the roof terrace!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: italybiker50
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Ravenna, Italy. I have travelled all over the country and stayed in many hotels. The room was great. Very quiet and the bed was comfortable. I like a soft bed. Hard to find in a hotel these days. The food in the hotel was very well done. But the best thing was the service. You could go to a more expensive hotel but you could not get better service than the Saturina. The staff made me and my family feel like they were taking care of their family. I could not have been happier. I would not stay anywhere else in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: aztravelsnob
Reviews.Content: this was hotel was our first stop on our italy vacation and we were very happy with our choice. The hotel is in a great location and easily walkable to anywhere you want to be. Our room was very nice and clean and the breakfast was great. overall great experience

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Hotel Saturnia”
Reviews.Author: GarethWoodfine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Hotel for four nights in June 2009. It was a good time to visit Venice, before the High Season. The Hotel is very conveniently situated and has all the facilities that we could reasonably require. The rooms were serviced immaculately. Above all, however, the multilingual Hotel staff were helpful, cheerful and considerate.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice while staying in Venice”
Reviews.Author: bocabayla
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, just off the far end and to the LEFT of St. Marks Square-- Room small but very tasteful, contemporary furnishings and very clean-- Located on a street with many posh shops, for shopping or not--Included buffet breakfast is ok, but not the coffee- Served in lovely garden courtyard--Except of the pesky sparrows attacking the food--Didn't eat in their restaurant--Went to Da Rafaella ( ask at the desk ) walking distance, right on a canal and watched all the gondolas go by as we dined-- Food and service good,. after you recover from the prices of everything in Venice in Euros.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Special Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hambo73
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in May in a superior room and loved very minute. The hotel is in a terrific location close to San Marco but just far out of the main traffic flow to enable those wishing to disappear into the more local areas very easy. The building is amazing ( a true venetian mansion) and the rooms simply stunning in a very modern decor. The rooms facilities were exceptionally stylish and high quality (great shower!). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient,helpful,friendly staff,great location,we will be back”
Reviews.Author: KokoWexford
Reviews.Content: This Hotel excels on the attention to detail by efficient friendly staff who are genuinely pleased to help.We had a wonderful week here and would love to return.................soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KVS1
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e booked the trip to Venice as a gift for my birthday. In fact, Saturnia was her second hotel choice. Well, if this is what you should expect from a 'second choice' hotel, I would go for second choice all the time! Saturnia is a great hotel, with distinctive character (and decoration!). Despite its central location, it was not at all noisy. As you may read in other reviews, its breakfast is pretty good and it also has a great (though a bit pricey) restaurant, La Caravella. What really impressed my fiancÃ©e and me was the fantastic staff of the hotel, and especially the reception. I have travelled around the world and it is rare that you get staff so friendly and so helpful. We spent more than an hour at the reception getting info about the places to visit or which opera event to attend ('Musica a Palazzo' was a great recommendation). The bottle of Prosecco for my birthday was also quite nice! All in all, we had a great time, and would highly recommend Saturnia.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience did not match all the reviews”
Reviews.Author: WindsorCali
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at Hotel Saturnia in 2001 with my sister while on a group tour. The hotel impressed me very much at that time. My husband and I booked our room directly with the hotel, through the internet with their "Spring Special". We stayed three nights at the end of our Italy travels. All communications prior to our arrival were very good. We we're arriving by train from Milan. Their instructions were accurate except that they did not warn us of the crowds we'd find on the public water taxis and how inconvenient it was when traveling with more than a carry on bag. The hotel is quite beautiful in the lobby and other public spaces. Very historical and charming. Our room, which faced the street, was large enough, but was awkward with the placement of the TV and there was really no seating except the bed. We had a very small balcony with a window opening onto the street. Unfortunately, and not forewarned, the building directly across was undergoing renovation so there was construction all day and into the early evening. Quite noisy. As ar as the staff; most everyone was friendly except the evening desk clerk who was surly and unfriendly each night. It felt as if we were bothering him. Not the family run atmosphere expected from other reviewers. The breakfast buffet was quite good with a lot of choices. There was limited to no internet access from our room using the passworods and login given. It was suggested to try in the lobby, no better. They never offered the option of using the hotels computers on the third floor. When I did ask the surly night clerk, he suggested using our own. Finally after explaining that we'd tried that numerous times he provided a new password and login. We then found a number of restrictions connecting to US sites. We did not try the Restaurant La Carvella as it was very pricey. Beware of the "free" round trip tour to the Murano glass factory. While the ride was wonderful, the tour informative, but a little short and hurried, there's the obigatory tour of the showrooms and some low pressure sales tactics which I did not appreciate or want. The other disappointment was a recommendation from Mr. Surly for a close restaurant. Must have been a relative. The food was awful and service worse. I'll review it under restaurants. Depending on your needs this may be a good fit, but having come from a fabulous small hotel in Milan (Hotel Manzoni) with excellent service and not too much pricer, I had expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: helegeir
Reviews.Content: Rooms and brakfast was very special. The staff was very helpfull and friendly. The location was perfect for walking roud the senter of town.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: winstonlucas
Reviews.Content: The staff were so helpful they organised everything we asked for so well . The room was out of this world spotlessly clean. Breakfast was buffet style with a great selection. We could not find fault with anything,An amazing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms, great staff....we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: Mason5150
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is hard to beat for the price. You can spend more but this Hotel offers great value for its location. We took a private boat ride to the hotel, it was a great experience. The Hotel staff is wonderful and VERY helpful. They are very glad you are in there Hotel and you really feel appreciated. It was and is an expensive hotel but I never felt it was'nt worth it. Never. We had a corner room suite that was on the back side of the hotel overlooking one of the small canel. Not reall a view but you can see and hear the gondola's going by below and the singing, it was great. Very quiet and safe and night. We would go out late at night for dinner and then walk around and ran into lots of police on foot. Felt very safe here. The location is the best and close to everything. The resturant in the hotel was very good, so if you get there late just go downstairs or order roomservice, it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere and Location”
Reviews.Author: Adam B
Reviews.Content: We spent two days during Carnival and wished we could have stayed longer. Our room was small but elegant the only problems were the uncomfortable bed, the very small lift and a safe that refused to open on one ocassion (quickly dealt with by staff) Breakfasts were good but rather hectic as there were a lot of guests and the room was quite small. The only real downside was the lack of any reasonable sized public area so trying to meet up with people became a bit fraught. The staff were most helpful and directed us to a wonderful restauranr next to the newly restored opera house for a special meal

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: sanela01
Reviews.Content: I came to Venice with a party of ten on a business off site meeting for 3 days and I was very happy that I have chosen Hotel Saturnia. Its location suited us really well. We were greeted at the airport by the hotel representative who then took us by water taxi to the hotel. The consigner greeted us on our arrival. We found him extremely helpful. All the staff were very professional and very helpful. They have met all our requirements for the meeting room and refreshments. We all had lovely rooms. We were also very impressed with hotel restaurant La Carvella and its staff, who looked after us extremely well. The food was excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit Venice. Sanela from London

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.. no problems at all!”
Reviews.Author: taracurtis
Reviews.Content: We booked online and got a very good rate - 115 euro's p.night for 2 adults 2 children. The best I could find online - apart from Santa Chiara, but was very glad not to have booked that hotel as it is bang slap in the middle of the bus station, not so lovely.. There was no faults to the hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was good. Our room was great, and the hotel is perfectly posotioned for exploring the city. We recommend you choose Saturnia, and hope you also have a great holiday

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat for location”
Reviews.Author: travellingchick81
Reviews.Content: This hotel was brilliant for location and access to all major sites. Our room was small and the bathroom dated, but we would stay again for the location to the centre of Venice. The included breakfast was more than sufficient and the staff were efficient and friendly. The organised gondola ride from the hotel was relatively good value although it was only 40 minutes, not 1 hour as the concierge had suggested.

Reviews.Title: “Give the Saturnia a ring”
Reviews.Author: ladyandtramp
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel in a convenient location for both St Marks and the river boats. Take the boat from the airport and walk about 100m to the hotel. I think you can buy 3 day "travel anywhere" passes for the boats and this appears to be an excellent deal, although Venice is a great walking city. We heard that not all the rooms had been decorated to the same standard but certainly the one we stayed in was magnificent as you can see in the photos. All staff we met were very efficient, more than charming, very professional. The restaurants at the side of the Rialto looked like typical tourist restaurants but actually were excellent, with really friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Fantastic Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: PBPCB
Reviews.Content: My 50th birthday treat from my husband was 4 days in Venice. This hotel made the treat even extra special. Plush, polished, beautiful, atmospheric, classy and sophisticated are just a few adjectives I could use. The staff were brilliant, breakfast great, room wonderful and location excellent. The hotel's restaurant, La Caravella, was intimate and exclusive. We had Christmas Eve dinner there (my birthday) and Christmas Day dinner there. The food was excellent and the service and attention second to none. The whole experience was totally fantastic and I will remember Christmas 2008 at the Hotel Saturnia & International in Venice forever!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: KUNAL-DELHI-INDIA
Reviews.Content: It was my third visit to the most romantic city in the world. As i was visitng with my wife i decided to go for Hotel Saturnia and i must say that it is worth every peeny spent. The hotel was so beautiful that at times we did not feel like leaving the property. The staff was very helpful and caring and an occasional grreting from the top managment added icing on the stay. The rooms are big and not like the tiny ones you get in other properties. The ancient venitian look added to it all. Over all having travelled the world it is a strong recommedation i would like to make. The approximity to the St. Marks square was also a great plus point. The concierge was an angel sent as he guided us for anything i had demanded. It seems the he was given the midas touch as i never heard a no from him. Overall i shall proudly say one of the best hotels i have stayed on a holiday. Food is a must to have with a amazing wine list having one of the rarest of wine collections. Abosolutely recomended. Looking forward to my next visit this january.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: michelle901
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with a nice breakfast selection In the best location you could think of - round the corner from St Marks Square and all the local sites We had a large room on the top floor which had a dining table, sofa, kitchen unit and large TV. Staff were very friendly and always helped with any queries. Venice was beautiful, we had fantastic weather for 4 days Would love to return and would not hesitate in recommending the hotel - FAB

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ShelbyH
Reviews.Content: I am very surprised with some of the mediocre reviews for this hotel. My husband and I stayed here two years ago and it was spectacular. We are planning to visit again in a couple of months. Even though TripAdvisor shows a 3 star rating, this is definitely a 4 star (plus) hotel. The location is incredible, especially for shopping... It is steps away from Gucci, Prada, Fendi, etc. The front desk was extremely helpful, getting us dinner reservations and water taxis whenever we needed them. And the rooms were very warm and plush (unlike many hotels in Italy with cold tile floors and uncomfortable furniture.) I highly recommend this hotel, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: zayatz
Reviews.Content: We booked a "Superior" room for four nights ($197/night from hotels.com) and received one of their two-story rooms (#106) which was fantastic! Lots of space. Large bathroom with bidet, hairdryer, adequate counter space, separate shower and tub (but no bathrobes). Living room downstairs with sofa, chairs, two desks, chest-of-drawers, flat-screen TV, high ceiling, electronic safe, and two mini-balconies for leaning out and viewing the small canal below. Loft bedroom upstairs with large bed, two chairs, separate A/C control, flat screen TV, and small bedside tables (but no drawers and no alarm clock). As something of a novelty, there's a thick glass window on the floor of the bedroom that looks straight down into the bathtub! Definitely a unique photo opp! Breakfast (served until 10:30) was good but nothing special and we did have to wait 5-10 minutes for a table on one or two mornings. The central location couldn't be better (unless you prefer a quieter and more secluded place). Sitting on a large (but expensive) shopping street, and very close to everything (including an ATM and a bookstore). San Moise church greets you from a half-block away. Five minute walk to Saint Mark's square. Five minute walk to two Vaporetto stops (then easy access to the train station, airport, Murano, Burano, San Giorgio, etc). Easy walk to Rialto Bridge, Accademia Bridge, Peggy Guggenheim Museum, etc. Front desk staff-members were extremely helpful. Internet access from two PC's on the second floor. Buy a 3-hour login/password from the front desk for 2 Euro's (which easily covered our entire stay). Nice view from the small rooftop terrace. Our basic Venice tip: Get some photos of (and from) the Rialto Bridge. Do the St Mark's attractions (Basilica, Bell-tower, Doge's), and then spend the rest of your vacation as far away as possible from these two crowded, expensive, pigeon-infested, tourist spots. Truly the best part of Venice is wandering around and getting lost among the maze-like side-streets where the food is better and cheaper, the stores are more interesting, and the crowds are much thinner. Then again, maybe the smart tip is to simply not go in August! I can't speak for the other rooms in this hotel, but if you can successfully request #106, you'll be very happy! We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: christinemckee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply perfect. We stayed the week we were in Venice to be married and the hotel stay was a highlight amongst many highlights. Staff were wonderful, friendly and extremely helpful. Our room was lovely - overlooking the interior courtyard at this time of year was quiet and lovely as every day we looked out to blue skies. The sun shone on us all week and especially on our big day. Leaving the hotel to head to Palazzo Cavalli for our ceremony was a dream come true. We left via the tiny pontoon at the back of the hotel onto the silent canal where we were taken by Royal Gondola to be married. We called the hotel our special home in Venice and for many reasons we will surely return to this lovely home from home.

Reviews.Title: “Got it last minute but room was tiny!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Irish
Reviews.Content: As expected in Venice, our room was tiny - just about fitted two single beds, two lockers and a TV. Our view was above a busy street and although this is a 4 star, I would more likely give it 3 stars. The shower had great pressure, but the water did smell?! Perhaps this is a venice thing! On saying that, on the plus side, the courtyard where they serve the buffet breakfast was lovely with lots of fresh fruit, croissants, and bacon and eggs. Although we were waiting a long time to order coffees - as it was really busy at 10am and the waiting staff looked quite miserable. The Hotel is old worldly and small, but it was adequate for our short stay in Venice. You can't beat the location, but it was missing that "je ne said quoi!" We got it last minute, so we were happy to not pay the full rate! Venice is fantastic and you really don't spend too much time in your room...or it would be a shame to anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: chocodolly
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this great hotel. The staff were really friendly and knowledgeable. The decor of the hotel is very venetian and comfortable. The room was very spacious, tastefully decorated, spotlessly clean with a beautiful bathroom and very comfortable bed. Breakfast had a great variety from continental to bacon and eggs, this was served outside in the courtyard which was very pretty. We had complimentary bubbly on arrival in our room and I cant actually think of anything negative. The roof terrace was also very pretty and relaxing with beautiful rooftop views. Would definately recommend and I will be going back. Oh yes and I am very fussy, so my husband says!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great rate, location, staff”
Reviews.Author: CorkReveller
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 4 night stay in Venice in this hotel - excellent location close to St Marks Sq, very safe area. V close to Water bus station too. Staff v friendly, food v good. Last night we stayed there, power went unexpectedly for 3-4 hours - all staff were extremely v apologetic and reduced the cost of our room on the last night by 30% - was very impressed with that. Really enjoyed breakfast. Served til 1030! One morning a couple arrived at 1040 and they were accomodated with full buffet selection also. 2 of the mornings it was v sunny so the buffet was set up in the courtyard. Very nice to eat breakfast in the sun shine!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Dorchy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic. Would highly recommend it to others and would go back there in a flash. The location was fantastic. A 5 minute walk from St Marks square and situated on a great shopping street (if you can afford Gucci, Prada etc etc!) if not, great for window shopping! We stayed in the most beautiful bedroom which had some lovely modern touches in amongst the traditional venetian decor. We were truly "wowed" when we first walked in. They also gave us a bottle of champagne on the house as they knew we were there for our honeymoon - great touch!! The service was truly fautless. Nothing was too much trouble and the staff were very smiley and knowledgable. The breakfast was very good and they offer a large variety. On the first night we ate in the hotels own restaurant - La Carvela - we highly recommend it. It was fairly pricey, but by far the best meal we ate while we were there and the atmosphere was beautiful The weather on the whole was very good and one late afternoon we sat on the roof terrace. Small but very comfortable with lovely sun loungers and magnificent views. Try and get up there if you can. Really cannot fault the hotel! Josh & Carly

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Hotel! Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: VarietyOntario
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough about this wonderful, beautiful hotel right in the centre of San Marco! We spent 3 fabulous days here in room #206. It was HUGE, including an extra-large tub, separate dressing room, separate shower and large bedroom with a Queen size bed. The room had 2 windows that overlooked the canal, and we were "seranaded" one morning by the gondoliers right under our window. The staff were excellent, and sent up some items from room service we needed for a picnic ... all complimentary. Highly recommend the Saturnia. It combines old-world design with modern conveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: bubblejenuk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night trip to Venice. The hotel is magnificent and centrally located and close to St Mark's Square. We had booked the hotel through last minute.com and we got it for half the price! We had read some mixed reviews of the hotel so we didn't really know what to expect but we actually got the best room in the hotel - a whole suite to ourselves on the top floor! The buffet breakfast was more than adequate including a mixture of croissants and scrambled eggs. There was a fabulous sun lounge/terrace on the top floor which is brill if you wanted to top up your tan without going to the beach! The shower was hot and strong and we defintely have no complaints whatsoever! Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in on holiday and I am extremely fussy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vicken11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in this hotel, and would definitely recommend it to anyone. The location is ideal and it is easy to find compared with other hotels as it is on one of the main streets of Venice leading from St Mark's Square and between two Vaporetto stops. The hotel itself is fabulous, the room was lovely and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast included is excellent, and we ate in the hotel restaurant, which is presumed to be one of the best in the region of Venice, and the food was lovely. It cost us about â‚¬150 for two people for two courses, a bottle of wine and desert wine, which is pretty reasonable. I can't think of any downsides about this hotel, and we saved 50% on the booking through lastminute.com as a Mystery Hotel, so well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: daisy3545
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the hotel Saturnia. Really loved the hotel,great location, very near to st marks square. Ate in the hotel restaurant, La Caravella, pricey but well worth it!!! Booked the hotel as a secret hotel on last minute.com, so got it half price!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: BreezygirlNorthHerts
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at the Saturnia & International Venice. We had a great time. The hotel was extremely well situated close to St Mark's Square and the staff were pleasant, friendly and helpful at all times. Our room was large and comfortable although the bed was terribly hard and I still have back ache almost a week later! We were located on the 2nd floor and overlooked the canal which was gorgeous as we were serenaded by the gondoliers and watched gondolas floating past filled with Japanese tourists giggling in the rain! The downside was that it was very noisy in the morning as there was a hotel kitchen on the other side of our narrow section of the canal where the rubbish was loaded onto a huge boat! We would return to Venice tomorrow, tho' we wouldn't eat at the Tavernetta San Maurizio (Left turn when you leave the hotel and see my restaurant review) because of it's proprietor and poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: hertshezbulla
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights 13th April 2008. Great Hotel and really helpful staff. Nice room and bathroom. Got the deal as the mystery hotel on Lastminute .com so you dont know where your going till you've booked. Basically the room was half price-RESULT!!!!!!!!!! Hotel is in a great location and handy for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel & Great location”
Reviews.Author: ConwyJetsetters
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in Hotel Saturina, the hotel is in a great location for St Marks Square, lots of resturants and designer shops. the hotel is very clean and the rooms are of a good standard.I celebrated my birthday during the stay ,much to our suprise the hotel had put a bottle of champangne in the room on my birthday, nobody had told them so they are very observent when taking ur details from passports I would recommend this hotel 100%

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: infiniteNY
Reviews.Content: Overall a good hotel. The rooms are small, but that's Europe. Our room did not have a very good view, but we were not in the room that much. The hotel is clean and the rooms were clean. The breakfast that they serve is very good. The best thing is the location. Close to St. Marks square and all brand name stores (if you want to shop). Overall we were satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LHFlynn
Reviews.Content: Great central location; close to Piazza San Marco Room was very large with a very hard bed that had the width of a king size bed, but was quite a bit shorter (my 6â€™ 2 Â½â€� husbandâ€™s feet hung over the end) & 2 cots. It was dark, very baroque, with no view at all. Bathroom was very small, but adequate. Breakfast was outstanding with a great deal of variety and the scrambled eggs were remarkably good & moist The outstanding multilingual daytime concierge Andrea Scarpa was extremely pleasant and helpful. He not only went out of his way to help us communicate with Eurofly about locating my husbandâ€™s missing bag, he directed me to the farmacia and the hospital when my son came down with tonsillitis. The night concierge, on the other hand, had a bit of an attitude. Free Internet with a code since we had our own laptop

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaSingle
Reviews.Content: First trip to Venice. Only stayed one night at the Hotel Saturnia. First the location - it is right on one of the main fashion streets with Hermes, Gucci, Prada, etc nearby. It's a couple of long blocks (in US terms) back to St Marks Square, and also convienent to walk to Rialto Bridge or Acadamia Gallery area. Not sure there would be a better location, expect for maybe the hotels on the opposite side of the street where you may have Grand Canal views from some rooms. Entering the hotel, you really feel that you step back in time. Everything looks old, but in a nice, comfortable way. The front desk dominates the lobby/reception area. It's interesting that they still use ledgers to track the rooms and also provide old fashioned room keys for each room, which you drop off and pick up each time you enter and leave the hotel. Kind of nice in that you get to chat briefly with the front desk staff, who are very helpful in offering planning for your stay in Venice. Had a room on the second floor (which I think they consider the first floor of rooms. Ours overlooked the beautiful courtyard which is used for the restaurant attached to the hotel. It is a great place to congregate in the afternoon and evening for a drink (with live music later in the evening - not loud, very appropriate to dinner/cocktails). The room was huge and quite a surprise for what I had expected for Venice, or anywhere in Europe for that matter. The beds were very comfortable. Our bath had been renovated and was a great shower (with rain showerhead and separate handheld nozzle) and a large soaking tub. The furnishings were old, but just exactly right to fit with the historic feel of the hotel. The service was quite good while there, especially the front desk which serves as a concierge. One little hint if you stay here, locate the rooftop terrace - which is not that easy to do, and you will be pleasantly surprised to find teak lounge chairs and other seating on a brick terrace overlooking the rooftops of Venice! A great place to rest up for your next walk around Venice. Leaving the hotel for the airport, they can call a water taxi which comes directly to the back of the hotel (easily accessed through the rear of the property off the main lobby). It's not the Ritz Carlton as we expect in US standards, but it is very comfortable property in a great location in one of the great cities of the world. The charm of the hotel matches that of the city.

Reviews.Title: “IMHO The Best Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: agatha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I always stay at the Saturnia in Venice, Italy. it doesnt has "views' and is not on the Grqand Canal. It is a hotel for people who want excellent service, beautiful rooms, large bathrooms, and a perfect breakfast. The concierge, Andrea Scarpa, is the best in the world. Nothing is too much for him to do for you to make your stay as wonderful as Venice itself. The breakfast is served in a beutiful court yard with a tranquil feeling to start your day on the right foot. Your favorite newspaper is waiting at the front desk by 9 AM. There is a roof deck with sun chairs if you feel your tan needs topping up in the afternoon. You can walk to San Marco Sq., in five minutes. The vaporetto stop is another 5 minutes in the opp direction.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but...”
Reviews.Author: jmfh
Reviews.Content: The best quality of this hotel is its location, butâ€¦ you should notice that you are in the heart of Venice for tourists, so everything you will found in the surroundings is very expensive. The hotel is located in the most fashion street of Venice all the most fashion brands have their shops near by, If you love old fashion furniture, I recognize they are nice, then youâ€™ll love this hotel but if you love practical atmosphere, this is not your place. The size of the room was correct even big for the Venice standards. The bathroom looks old fashion and I think it needs a new look, but it was clean and operative. The breakfast was correct in a nice old dining room. The staff was kind and professional. The rooms are set twice a day. We stayed in the back of the hotel and there was no noise. The Hotel looks, and I think wants to look, like an old Venetian palace.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, easy place to stay with baby”
Reviews.Author: Tooki
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is a real gem only a few minutes walk from St Mark's Square. We found hotel staff to be friendly and helpful. We stayed with our 5 month baby in a balcony bedroom on the first floor which they offered us for the same price as a low season standard double for four nights after new year. All first floor rooms open directly onto a large living area with a carved elegant staircase and grand piano. We could sit in this area in the evening with our baby monitor outside our room door and order drinks to be brought up from the bar. Our room was lovely and comfortable with a large bathroom with separate bath and shower, and two large sinks. The hotel cot provided had a slight dip in the middle as it was hinged for storage but our baby slept well on it. The food and ambience in the La Caravella restuarant were both superb, expensive though, expect to pay Â£70 + for two courses and two glasses of wine for two. Alternatively you could buy two small pizzas from the street bar around the corner for Â£4 or eat out for anything in between. There was an extensive continental and british breakfast buffet every morning, absolutely delicious. Overall a first rate experience, staying so near St Marks Square made it easy with a baby as we could go out for an hour's wander without even a nappy bag as it was so easy to nip back to our room. A note about Venice with a baby though; we did not notice anywhere you could buy nappies, all shops are touristy, but luckily we took enough! Also we left our pushchair in the UK and only took a baby carrier which was definately the right decision as there are steps everwhere so we would have just ended up carrying a pushchair and a baby had we taken it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Needs Work, Insolent Staff”
Reviews.Author: opinion_from_ny
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here in December and were extremely disappointed by the experience. It would have been "okay, but some problems," had the night manager not been so insolent. The rooms are a bit tired and old, and the beds especially uncomfortable. This might change in the near future as the hotel is currently undergoing renovations (which contributed to our problem). The first room we were given faced the street and remained extremely noisy into the night. The night manager begrudgingly reassigned us to another room after initially refusing--he said that given the hotel's current renovations, a large portion of the hotel was closed off. In the new room the bathtub was extremely slippery and my mom fell. The beds were also sinking in the middle, which would have made for an extremely uncomfortable night. We requested to be moved back to our original room (a noisy room seemed like a better option than an unsafe/uncomfortable one, and the night manager had already given us such a hard time about changing rooms in the first place, we didn't think he'd assign us to a new room), and the manager only did so after much resistance. Overall, the hotel would have been cute, and the rooms will likely be in better condition post-renovations, but our experience with the night manager and other staff was unacceptable. The other desk personnel were aloof and reluctant to help with problems. The one exception was the day concierge (Giovanni?), who is a real gem and went out of his way to be helpful. Given the large number of options in Venice, I'd recommend looking elsewhere for accommodation--why take the gamble as to whether the staff will be helpful/you'll get a good room when you don't have to?

Reviews.Title: “This hotel lived up to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: UkParky
Reviews.Content: In summary - a wonderful hotel. I cannot decide whether the most outstanding feature was the quality of the staff or the quality of the food. Either way a meal in the restaurant (La Caravella) is a must. We chose the Saturnia based on tripadvisor reviews. We had two connecting rooms (double superior and triple standard). We stayed Christmas eve through till 27th December. We have stayed in Venice twice before and had experienced adequate but slightly haughty service. The Saturnia experience was quite different. It began with the very prompt, friendly and personalised responses to my initial e-mail enquiries. Our needs were understood and responded to very effectively. On arrival we were clearly expected and greeted by name. The rooms were normal european size with the larger superior double big enough to form the gathering point for the present opening on Christmas day (5 people). Bathrooms in both rooms were very smart marble affairs. The hotel has a lovely communal sitting area on the first floor - a great place for residents to gather, lounge and chat. We dined twice in the restaurant. Both meals were exceptionally good. One of them was a "free" one (i.e. part of the package) but in our view even surpassed the wonderful meal we paid for. The ambience and personal service were of the very highest quality. We also ate locally at La Borsa (out the door, left and left again). Another great find as an alternative to the hotel's restaurant. Location is great for shopping, promenading (OK posing!), shopping and site seeing. All in all, the reviewers were right. The Saturnia is to be thoroughly recommended - we'll be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: SRQRedhead
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. We had a room on the 2nd floor at the front of the hotel overlooking the street, but it was very quiet. The room was fairly large for european standards, bathroom was quite spacious. Ceilings were high and beds were comfortable. The Hotel staff were very helpful - not great at recommending restaurants (they recommended the hotel restaurant which was good but pricey). They did direct us to a great place for gelato after dinner and walking back we found several other restaurants we wanted to try. Our favorite was Gallileo - only a short walk from the hotel, on a square. Breakfast was plentiful, a selection of breads, breakfast cakes, scrambled eggs, eggs you could soft or hard boil yourself in a water bath, bacon, cold ham, cheeses, various jams, yogurt. Fresh fruit (apples and oranges) and several fruit juices. One plus was free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, do not expect canal views”
Reviews.Author: Orbit0353
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Saturnia. The central location is excellent when travelling children, as you can easily get back to the hotel for a short rest during the day from most sights. If you need or expect gorgeous canal views, look otherwhere (and at more pricier alternatives). Our room (66) was facing a back street, which where quiet. A front side room would get you a a street view, but also facing a busy pedestrian area. The room was large and tidy, with one king + two single beds for the children. Excellent bathroom. The beds were quite hard, even harder than otherwhere in Italy (where even 5*+ hotels were too hard for our taste) There is a nice roof terrace that we visited both afternoons, finding it completely vacant. Follow the stairs that goes around the elevators, and you can't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LondonsTraveller
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Marco Polo airport and found the hotel so easily travelling via waterbus (ACTV)- it's 5 mins from the drop off point (san marco square). The location is perfect. The hotel is a small hotel, the staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are average and you can hear people walking past in the mornings. It's a bit like a shared house. Our room (no 25) over looked the main street which has various shops including Gucci and we could also hear the people traffic and entertainers in the morning. It's a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: JaneTraveler2
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Saturnia in Venice....great taste of Italy. The hotel had a top-notch restaurant, the concierge was so welcoming and spoke a million different languages. The rooms displayed a beautiful taste of Venice with venetian chandeliers. The 7 of us travelling to Venice would stay here again in a heartbeat. The location was second to none...near everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: ssp011204
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at the Saturnia for 2 nights and thought that the location was convienent to St. Mark's square and the bathroom quite large but that the bed was terribly uncomfortable. For the money, I wouldn't stay here again and would surely ask to not be placed near the restaurant due to the loud noises heard each evening/morning. Other tips: If you do stay here, take the #82 (make sure it goes to San Marco) public transport (5 Euros/pp) and walk just a few minutes (will need to cross one small bridge) to the hotel. It's not a 15 min walk and is very doable. Don't eat near the touristy areas near the square or Rialto bride (the food is very pricey and the worst I've had in Italy in 2 weeks). Walk away from there areas and find a smaller, more intimate restaurant (we enjoyed the Ristorante de Carla recommended by Rick Steves). Two days are enough in Venice and there is no need to go to the Correr Museum. The gelato at the La Boutique del Gelato also wasn't worth the search.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, BUT.......”
Reviews.Author: bonamak20
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a 5 min walk from the Doges Palace and pretty much anything you need to see in Venice. Absolutely prime location, however, it was veryyyy expensive ($450/night) for what you're getting. The hotel is very small, and very old. The floors creak, the bed squeaks a lot, and it has that old smell in the room. You feel like you're in an ancient house. The buffet breakfast was very good (and included). The concierege was very helpful. I wouldn't stay here again for this price, Venice is pretty small, so if you're a little farther away, it's not that big of a deal. Plus, the ride anywhere is on water, so it's nice.

Reviews.Title: “A bit pricey, but very NICE hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly located in the heart of Venice. It's very pretty. Staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. The standard king room is small with no real view, but pretty, clean, and has all the necessary amenities. Air conditioner works with limited strength. Water taxi pulls up right in back of hotel, but the cost fr the airport is very hefty (apprx 100-120 euros). The water taxi will take up to 4 people....arrange to split ride if possible. The waterBUS (11 euros/pp) is an option, but a pretty painful one. It takes about an hour to get to the San Marco piazza (makes several other stops along the way), and then you'll have to drag your bags thru the streets to get to the hotel...approx. 15 minute walk thru chaos of people and outside merchants. FYI....water taxi to train station is 65 euros, and takes all of 10 minutes. Ask hotel staff if they have other people going to train station, and offer to split water taxi ride. The hotel will NOT offer this as an option...you will have to ask. The restaurant in the hotel, The Caravella, is very good, but also pricey. All-in-all, our stay at this hotel was very enjoyable and recommended. Two nights in Venice is sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: minx6469
Reviews.Content: From the rave reviews on TripAdvisor, I expected more from this hotel. I have traveled to Europe before and I was aware that the hotel rooms were smaller than American hotels, but I was still surprised by the size and quality. The bed was hard and the room was damp. The bathroom might as well have been a closet (you could use the toilet and brush your teeth at the same time without stretching). We didn't attempt to use the air conditioning since we read other reviews stating it didn't work. We opened the windows and that kept the room cool but expect mosquitos. The restuarant, La Caravella, was very good but pricey. Don't eat there on a busy night because they'll forget about you and you'll be stuck waiting around. The best part was the breakfast. A wonderful spread that was very inviting. The staff was polite, but seemed like they had their own agenda. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “should have been better!”
Reviews.Author: pandpCalifornia
Reviews.Content: 2 rooms, and 5 people, averaging over $300 a night per room. No air conditioninng despite unseasonably hot Venice weather. When the desk was asked, they merely shrug sholdiers. Yes, opening the window was great, except the hotel has no screens and the mosquitos simply ate us alive!!! Plus, the noise around the hotel and espcially, one of our rooms which shared proximity with the hotel restaurant resulted in smoking coming up into our windows and having to hear the help dump garbage (including crashing empty wine bottles) each evening after midnight! Yes, the location is great, the rooms were fairly nice and breakfast above average. Please decline the so called "free" hotel tour to Murano and Burano. Its nothing other then a sales pitch, and to boot, once it was over, we were stranded on Burano being forced to either take a 100 euro taxi or que up for the crowded pulblic transportation home. When I complained at the desk, the reply was, somebody must have forgotten to tell youl As I said, the hotel should have been better, and I will not return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Paulinmorpeth
Reviews.Content: We have just retuned from 3 night stay at the Satunia & International Hotel. The hotel is in a great location, just a couple of minutes from Piazza San Marco and a short walk from the vaporetto stop near Harry's Bar. This was very fortunate as we were in Venice during Carnivale and a great deal was happening in the piazza. The Fenice is very near too and that area has some excellent little restaurants which offered good food at very reasonable prices (and people think Venice is expensive!) The staff were very helpful and the acilities at the hotel were very good.The breakfasts were great. A downside was that the hotel bar closed at 11.00 pm as did the bar along the street so if you want a late drink, look elsewhere. The room was pleasant and a good size but the bathroom was not up to four star standard. It was rather tired and looked as if it hadn't been upgraded for some years. Another surprise was being woken on our first morning by what sounded like staff coming into the room. It was coming from the floor above which must have been a staff room. Better sound insulation needed! Overall, a nice hotel in a good location but avoid room 74 if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Elegant Family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We traveled with five friends who have travelled the world. They were extremely impressed with the Hotel Saturnia's Staff, cleanlines and level of professionalism. Wonderful breakfasts, perfect location and most highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “very special”
Reviews.Author: Graham P
Reviews.Content: of all the hotels in all the world i can honestly say this is a very special place, where very special people go, people who know quality and are used to service. special people who dont expect but welcome to old fashioned joy of being served by an individual charged with your comfort and your needs, a family of Venicians who for generations taken care to maintain a tradition of being hosts to the world and its people no ,atter what colour class or creed, a family, who now enjoy continuity only because they give continuity and they pleasure in making every one feel very special, the family name is SERANDRE, and the quest is to please, most of all serve, just as the family has done for generations. the service from the cleaners through to the professionals that serve you in the restaurant cannot be compared, they are simply the best, words cannot express the real feeling i have this the most wonderful and the most friendlest of hotels in the world. go and see for yourself, but remember if you go with a closed mind or expectations based on previous experiences then dont go, because the Saturnia is like no other hotel, its is a very special place indeed, so much so i now call it my Venetian home with my Venecian friends waiting to welcome me and look after me as if i were their own. please try this hotel and preserve not only Venice but a family of hoteliers who are the very blood of this most beautifull cities, venice is a window into the past and its people an excample of elegance and civility that we fail to understand, due to our at times unrealistic expectations and arrogance, my name is graham peers i live in the uk , but my heart is in VENICE. enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: TexasYokel
Reviews.Content: Wasn't posh like our Rome and Florence hotels but very comfortable. Very friendly staff. Did talk us into taking dinner at the hotel the first night. Was just okay. They tried to send us to their other hotel the second night but we asked for and received a reccomendation and had a great dinner at a nearby restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good but trouble with mosquitoes”
Reviews.Author: lrnyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here our last night in Venice. Overall the hotel is nice and service is good. You definitely get the feel that you are in an old palace. Nice common areas on all floors. Free internet use on 2 computers on the 2nd floor. Rooms are charming but well worn. Our major problem was with mosquitoes. We had a room on the first floor over looking the canal on the side of the hotel. Had probably half dozen mosquitoes in the room. We had a terrrible night because of this and I actually was not able to sleep at all after getting bit several times. I would have insisted on changing rooms but it didn't seem worth the effort with all our bags etc. The concierge provided us a little bug repelent to plug into the wall...didn't work. I was up throwing my guidebook up to the ceiling to kill the mosquitoes (the ceilings are very high...). Some would argue that this could potentially happen at any hotel. I would say, however, that I've stayed at many many hotels over the years (including during this stay in Venice) and this has never happened before. I basically ended up paying $250 to stay up all night battling mosquitoes. It was a miserable night and the worst I've ever spent in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Saturnia one night pre-cruise. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Prior to arrival, I requested assistance in booking the Doges Palace Secret Itinerary tour which they took care of quickly and confirmed. They were wonderful in providing directions and though they did offer one of the private taxis to Murano, there was no pressure at all. We had a triple room which was really 2 rooms. Air conditioning functioned well, though throughout Europe, it is generally not what we are used to in the US. Clean room, comfortable beds, fresh flowers and a modern bath. Location was great no matter which direction we set out to. Free internet is available to guests as well, so it was nice to be able to let family know via email that our travels were going so well. Our breakfast was included and there was a nice selection of breads, rolls, eggs, yogurt, fruit, juices, etc in a courtyard setting. More than enough to start off our day. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MimTraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Saturnia in a deluxe room and were thrilled by the service and location of this charming hotel. The deluxe room was huge in size with a beautiful chandelier about the huge bed. The room was spotlessly clean and the bathroom very modern. The breakfasts were excellent with just about everything you can imagine. Also, the hotel has free internet access for guests which is so much nicer than trying to find an internet cafe. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is absolutely the best location you can get. Close to St Marks Square and walking distance to everything. The only thing that we didn't like is that there is no iron in the room (irons are forbidden in Italian hotel rooms apparently) and the laundry service is expensive. Overrall, the hotel was excellent. I didn't see the standard rooms so I can't comment on the negative input some other people have put on this site. But I couldn't fault this grand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Far and away the best of the 3 places we stayed during our recent trip to Italy (Florence, Tuscany, Venice). I'm not sure why there seems to be such divergent reviews about the overall condition of the hotel and the rooms. Our room was terrific. It was very updated, particularly the bathroom, and while not large by U.S. standards was more than large enough. I wonder whether some, but not all, of the rooms have been renovated(?). The common areas of the hotel had an older feel but to us that only add charm to the place. The staff was also great. There was always plenty of help around, and they assisted us with everything from restaurants, to water taxis, to gondolas. The prices for the things they arranged for us were also slightly less than what I had anticipated we'd pay. (100 euro for a gondola ride, for example). I'm not sure if I just overestimated the cost, but it generally felt like less than what I would have paid had I done it myself. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant (though it looked good) but did have coffee in the bar a couple of afternoons, which was really nice. The breakfast buffet was fine by european standards. I don't recall the exact price we paid, but it wasn't extraordinarily high, particularly by Venice standards. While I'm sure there are cheaper places to stay, we felt the Saturnia was a great value for everything we got out of it. If we return to Venice (which we hope to) I'm sure we'll try to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Special Hotel-Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: The-Georgia-Longs
Reviews.Content: We loved the Saturnia! We arrived by water taxi to the back entrance and were immediately entralled by the dungeon type entrance. The hotel staff were very courteous, and got our room ready so that we could unpack. From our interactions with the staff, you could tell they were there to help. The interior of the hotel is beautiful! The room was attractive, with hardwood floors and marble bath. Great third bed for our daughter, and room was extra big to accomodate. Bed was the best we found in Italy out of the three we stayed. Bathroom was extra large, and had two separate rooms. Bathtub was nice for relaxing bath after a long day of walking! The location was perfect! Great shopping district just down from San Marco. The buffet breakfast was a extreme treat. They had everthing you could think of, and the coffee and tea service was perfect. This is a great hotel for a family with a child/children, spacious, clean and breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but lousy room”
Reviews.Author: peters4
Reviews.Content: While the location is hard to beat -- midway between St. Marks Plaza and the Accademia Bridge, there was little else to recommend the Saturnia. My room -- a single on the 4th floor of the front portion of the hotel -- was of medium size but lacked two important things: drawers and a place, other than the bed, to sit. Yes, there were chairs but there wasn't enough floor space to slide either of them out from under the writing surface (not a desk, just a flat panel jutting out from the wall. And, yes you read it right: no drawers (other than the two small ones in each of the two small tables next to the bed. Overall, I dreaded coming back to the hotel and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some renovation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel but very old, but that is presumably what many want when going to Venice. I liked the old room (and ours was a good size) but the bathroom could have done with renovating. The hallways could also have done with renovating and were somewhat shabby. We booked on this site and payed approximately 721 euro for 4 nights (180 a night). The positives were the breakfast was nice, with plenty of choice, and the staff were efficient but not particulary friendly. The hotel is in an excellent location but there are no waterfront views. You can walk to St. Marks Square in about 5 minutes. The resturant in the hotel, had lovely food but was very expensive. The hotel would be much improved if they made some basic renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: airpixie
Reviews.Content: In all fairness, I think that unless you spend a fortune on a room in Venice, this and most hotels are probably similar in quality. Upon entering this hotel, I found it to be older, darker, and somewhat tatty at first. The staff were extremely friendly though. The room was a good size and had antique furniture with decent bedding although the chairs in the room were in pretty bad shape. There were great big windows that opened up and overlooked a courtyard that had a metalsmith shop (I think) which was quite noisy at times. However old it was, you get the feeling that THAT is part of the charm of Venice and what you would find at the hotel down the road. It was in a fantastic location, within walking distance to everything. The staff in the restaurant for breakfast were also incredibly nice. So... would I stay here again? For the the price and location- yes. It grew on me and even though it isn't the fanciest place by any means, it served our purpose and was charming in its own way.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reading the rave reviews for this hotel makes one wonder where else the reviewers have stayed. I should hope the breakfasts are good. The only things cooked are the eggs and bacon. Nicely furnished room with a great bathroom. Staff helpful. Nothing that shouldn't be expected in a hotel charging such high rates.

Reviews.Title: “The standard rooms are dingy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After looking at 2 standard rooms, only one with bath, we decided to upgrade for 30 euros to a deluxe. Well worth it, it was really nice, but the better rooms seem to all face a noisy street. Noise at all hours, and no fan to muffle the noise. Be sure you go when the AC works! Front desk staff was great with one exception, and the breakfast staff was very good. If they offer to get you a TAXI to the train station, ASK THE PRICE. 60 euros for a 10 minute boat ride. OUCH!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraB22
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel as arranged through Perillo Tours. Although the breakfast was wonderful, as were the front desk personnel, the room we had was awful!! Our room was so small we could barely move around. To make matters worse, our luggage had to be kept on the floor since there was no space for it elsewhere; and, taking a shower was a lesson in contortion control. We actually had to maneuver sideways to even get into the bathroom. We did, however, visit some other rooms that were spacious, well lighted, and wonderful. My suggestion, be specific about the room you pay for, BEFORE agreeing to stay at this wonderful location in Venice.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Saturnia & International
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Larga Via XXII Marzo 2398 | San Marco, 30124 Venice, Italy
